A2pyUVPiqoGvPRavpHqbaQ.text: The noodle soup I ordered was salty and only had 3 shrimps and a few squids in a so-called seafood Tom yum soup. It was bad and way overpriced. Would never come back

n-K1V9zLZhIWGr3ekIr3mg.text: We had the honey BBQ pork and roasted duck noodle soup and were very happy with both out dishes.  It came with Chinese Broccoli which was a plus.  The broth was flavorful for us - we drank the whole bowl.  I would come here again.

c79IGUx7GTN-E64-d_OaJQ.text: So....I decided to ignore the 234 review 2 star rating......and you get what you deserve.......2 stars at best.  Over priced (yes, even for Vegas standards) and just ok to mediocre food.  Do yourself a favor and listen to those who took the time to review this place.  Mandalay Bay, time for a change in tenants........

uN72tYVXFIaETaYE5DgyPw.text: Giving this place 1 star because I can't give a 0. The service sucked, the front desk lady had the most rude tone of voice. Also the food is way too overpriced for its taste and quality. The 5 dollar bowl of hot and sour soup was the size of my palm and it wasn't spicy or sour, it was bland!

zZoC2mqAMACovnfJzqBMFg.text: Unfortunately we were in a hurry to eat before dashing off to a show, so we didn't bother to look at any reviews before crossing the threshold. Strategic error.   Our party ordered, among other things, the pad thai and the duck. I had the pad thai, which literally consisted of over 50% grilled white onions. Seriously.  There were more onions than noodles.  The chicken was undercooked, and possibly a little raw.  My brother's duck was mostly bone and skin. All of this was way overpriced. Avoid. Avoid. Avoid.

G3ErSuDonb9KZHo_fMhVcg.text: Food here....yuck!  I ordered the seafood soup which tasted bland, others ordered the pho, Mongolian beef, etc, and all seemed like it was missing something.  Not talking about MSG, but it seems they didn't even bother to taste or season well the food.  And to compound our wonderful excursion, the waitress when giving the bill said, "Don't forget to leave tip!"  I usually leave more than 20% when I eat out, this time, she doesn't even deserve half that!  In summary, yucky food, high not worth prices, and rude service.  A must skip if ever in the Mandalay Bay Hotel!

JSKKhFAZlL4j14xhabNKPA.text: If you want the most expensive, least bang for your buck, biggest ripoff of a restaurant you can imagine, come here.  $8 for a bowl of soup (3-4 spoonfuls)?  My Chinese ancestors, preaching a culture of frugality, are rolling over in their graves.  I hate this place for making me feel so unjustified for spending that money...and seeing as that's all you do in Vegas w/ gambling and partying, for the Noodle Shop to be my biggest loss that weekend is just sad.

duNYsRmHREtw-Ve4WW3Y2A.text: Ok, dined here last night for the third time in 2 years. Sorry Mandalay Bay but the Noodle Shop is just terrible and horribly overpriced. I swear the chefs have no idea what chinese and thai food is supposed to taste like. If I buy an asian cookbook can I open a restaurant?  Seriously, for the third time the pad thai was a wattery soup that tasted like jiffy peanut butter.  The lettuce wraps had absolutly NO seasoning or flavor. The mu shu duck was fair but the pancake was so dry it just crumbled upon folding. Why is this place soooooo bad yet stays alive. If you think panda express is great asian food you will still be utterly disappointed! There are so many great noodle shops in Vegas that are traditional, delicious,  and less expensive, try the one in the back corner of the Venetian!  By the way, I was sober every time I've eaten here.  Do not waste your money or one good evening in Vegas.

bLXk-9H7NQkVgTko7z9Y5Q.text: Stopped by here on Sunday hoping to get a bite of some hot soup (great after a night of drinking) before our flight  - we had one hour to kill before we head to the airport for our flight - after being seated, we waited around for liek 10 minutes and hadn't even been served water yet!!!!! so we figured service was going to be suuuuuper slow Add that to the prices (16 bux for a bowl of pho! 12 for a bowl of wonton soup!), we just got up and left the service was so bad, they didn't even notice we were there in the first place

tngCe4BcS1I4it28m_8Niw.text: The food definitely was not anything special. I would say it was a step up from a Chinese dollar scoop. More likely to get better food at a PF Changs. But the service was fine and we did not have to wait long for the food. Our glasses never went empty and the hot jasmine tea was bottomless.

Z578Xxti6wI2HJ_E4iQLHg.text: Best way to describe this place is fast food Chinese. Food was not fresh and was previously prepared. Rice was dry.

tP0wK5xcXZ0zBvogTVHJEA.text: Eh, not that great.  I definitely expected a lot more because of the location and price of the restaurant.  The service was not that great.  I actually had my bill slapped on my table as I was eating my lunch.  He expected me to pay too! but that wasn't really why I gave it 3 stars.  The food wasn't that good.  I tried the thai spicy noodles that costed me 15 bucks.  Ugh, just.. not that amazing.  Mediocre, poor service, and just bleh.    I really liked the interior design though!

TLIXyIbdHuQ_vXUzGvDJ-g.text: Expensive and bland! My grandma always has to get her soup on when she gambles, so we came here and good lorddddddddd... I am better off eating Cup O Noodles in my room, which are so much more flavorful!  The staff could use some flavor too!  Everyone had this look on their face!  Maybe their coworker just passed away, and if that is the case, then I take back what I said, but if not, then based on their facial expressions, this is what they say about Noodle: "Don't come eat this pathetic excuse of an Asian restaurant." I know it is Vegas, so it will be generic tasting.  I'll give them a star for trying and another for their wide range of Asian dishes.

FcFZom-XsOXss-akBFLvXg.text: I paid $20 for a seafood pan fried noodle that was pretty bland. I ordered takeout, so if I had to say one good thing about this place, its that it took them about 5 minutes to make my food.  Other than that, if you're at the casino and you're hungry, do yourself a favor and get out to In-N-Out. Or, walk across the street to Panda Express and/or McDonald's.

DX2ClQRpEQJFqOm6GPLUiQ.text: EXPENSIVE NOODLE SOUP, but boiling hot soup sure does help from a night of hard partying in Vegas. Sure it's 110 degrees outside, but inside the Mandalay it's a cool, crisp 70+ degrees!  I only had the Roasted Pork Egg Noodle Soup and I must say, I LOVED IT. I loved watching the oil sit on the top layer of my soup (HELLO, oil is the cure to a mean hangover in my book).  Oh and I really did want to try the Har Gow but I couldn't justify spending $8.50 on something that usually costs less than $2.   I'm going back to Vegas in Sept... so I'll be here again. Prices suck, yes.... but it's going to be the same no matter where you go!

tBjeqqLRXuqyB_ZmwWDMzg.text: We were looking to carb-load the night before the marathon, so we took a vote, and noodles it was. It's this weird veneer of vegas flash over Chinese dive, you know, one of those places where there's a secret menu and the server wants to know if you can REALLY handle spicy.  One of the gals tried to order the beef flank steak with noodle soup (essentially mi with tendon), and was immediately and strongly discouraged by the waiter.  The soups were the strong point -- broths were good, the wonton soup with a boatload of wontons and noodles is a Vegas steal at $10 for a huge bowl. The more generic dishes, like beef with broccoli, etc, were just gummy and salty and AWFUL.

GglzOlqF-WY3aijefCNIyg.text: Since my son wanted some Asian food and this place is just downstairs we had to give it a try. We had BBq pork -roast duck combo. Fried rice. All we good  also my son had the wor won ton soup.  As with every one else I think it was pricey for the type of food.  What I don't understand is  if the food is blah why is it so dang busy.  The 1st time we ate there we were greeted and seated within minutes.  The 2nd time we ate there yes we ate there twice. The was a wait for about 15 minutes or so before we got in.  The waiter were ok although they do tend to forget about once they serve your food.  Over all experience 2 stars If I only knew there was a Panda express across the street you'll be better off eating there.

iLe6p4egSUX9sPq4PKD_cg.text: Yummy Singapore Noodles and pork dumplings. I love the little hot sauces they have on the table too, great for mixing with rice/noodles/ etc. SUPER friendly service. Expensive -sure but still cheaper than the main restaurants!  Save the money - don't eat at Shanghai Lilly -just eat at the Noodle Shop!

yQHb0xpUZyki7IePOs9Mig.text: We ordered Moo shoo Duck, Wonton Noodle Soup, and Pad Thai. The Moo Shoo Duck was a bit salty and the wrappers were dry and fell apart before anything was added to it. The wonton were really still and hard and you couldn't tell if there was shrimp in there or not. The noodles were soft, which was nice but not memorable. The Pad Thai was flavorless and the noodles were HARD!!   The busboy who brought out the drinks was efficient. Our server who brought out our food was in some big rush even though the place was pretty empty. He reminded me of Jackie Chan, running around, carrying a zillion plates and putting them on our table so fast and talking a mile a minute that we could barely comprehend what was going on.   The restaurant is pretty nice and clean, but I've had better food for half the price.

hoJqKXP_BGVSXQM0BBv4zQ.text: We went in for a late dinner, about 9pm. Got the chicken chow mien and Singapore noodles. Both dishes came out pretty quick. Both were really tasty, and good size portions. Would have given 5 stars but for the cost.

Wx1Sfvus1W9RqUDy8jTOJA.text: My wife and I went here on our anniversary.   This was by far the worst Chinese food we have had in years with prices 2-3 times what you expect to pay at a decent establishment like PF Changs.   We order the hot tea. This was $10..... a pathetic cucumber salad $10, cup of egg drop soup $7.50 and some pork sliders $12.  All of it was sub par and not even close to expectations for the price paid...... we noticed that there were very few diners in the establishment...... perhaps because nobody ever goes back....

F08lqIODSOJDnlFbvrttHQ.text: I wish I had my phone on me before we ate at this place so I could've seen the bad reviews and decide to go somewhere else! The menu looked appetizing and promising but everything from the food to the service is just disappointing. I knew we should've left when we sat there for several minutes waiting for someone take our drink order.Three different people took our drink order but no one brought our drinks...it was so bizarre. Also, it was not busy when we arrived. There was one other table seated when we arrived. We were going to try the dumpling sampler until we were told it would take at least 20 minutes to prepare. I was going to try the Hong Kong noodles, but when the waitress described the dish to me, I decided to just go with the fried rice. My husband had the kung pao chicken, which was nothing special. The fried chicken lacked flavor and had more egg in every bite than anything else. If you want good food, keep walking, you won't find it here.

sOt4DpPsgkeWnNJts5-oeA.text: Me and my girlfriend walked in right behind a different couple....they got served along with ice water offered....we sat there for over 15 min without anyone asking us if we wanted anything to drink.  The restaurant wasn't busy, maybe 6 tables total.  WTF Finally received our water....straight up tap water where I can taste the treatment chemical...yuck.  WTF The noodles soup came out very quick....alert...if you are asian...dont come here.  The soup is tasteless...yuck......one of the worst, if not the worst noodles soup ever.....and it cost $22 a bowl...WTF I think they use the can soup to cook the broth because there is no way anyone can cook such bad broth.  To sum up... Bad service The worst food Super expensive

SZnH1hwRB0pUlEnnQZ3MXA.text: Lunch was actually really good.  It was at the Mandalay Bay.  I had the Hong Kong style crispy noodle with beef.  Lots of tender beef with mushrooms.  Salty base, hard to eat as soup.  The noodles were awesome and the beef very tender.  I think a few too many snow peas.   I could of had a little more beef.  Dish overall was a winner.  Staff was helpful.  Overall I recommend

myLtqk_OhgMhQ8uWb699iQ.text: The food has great flavor. My friend got the Pho soup and I got the Pad Thai. Both were made so well, tasted amazing. Huge plate of food, I didn't think I'd finish it, but I did! Every last bite. The manager was such a genuinely happy, funny, friendly and engaging man. We went here after watching the Michael Jackson ONE show which was amazing and the perfect food to follow watching great entertainment. I'd come here again next time I'm in Las Vegas.

gB2crd78Jbs_u2kqYeZ2dw.text: Very good food and service. Fairly authentic. Fast, tasty and economical. I would recommend if you are craving Chinese food.

dojFwZV4KygbkifdpeEw9A.text: We shared a vegetable chow mein and vegetable spring rolls. There were barely any veggies in the chow mein and the spring rolls seemed like the standard frozen ones tossed into a deep fryer. I would only eat here again if drunk at 3 am with no where else to go. Service was fine.

TCe1zXu4ISo9pQH3F2DOyw.text: Seriously terrible and disappointing. $30+ for some lame shit tossed in soy sauce. Service is bad. Porridge is okay but the meat in it is terrible.   If you're Asian and have any idea what authentic Asian food tastes like, then you won't like it here. If you think Panda Express = good Chinese food, then you might have a chance.   It's Panda-level, maybe even below...sometimes Panda is good.  Do yourself a favor and keep walking when you see the menu sitting outside. I walked by it 3 times and finally gave in. Biggest mistake of my life this week.   I didn't give it a 1 star because I save that honor for places that I truly hate. This place is just truly disappointing.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So gross...oh so gross.

-zojGYlPDcoQkL5Jeo6i1A.text: The food was so whack. My dad and I ordered the wonton noodles and they were very soft, almost like rice noodles instead of a slightly gummy/al dente texture that egg noodles are supposed to have. My dad's coworker ordered pad thai, which was oddly yellow in color, something I've never seen any restaurant make before. They also didn't have any Vietnamese coffee because they were apparently having issues with their supplier or something. The prices are high, but it is what it is being a Vegas hotel restaurant.   The waiter on the other hand was very friendly and I felt bad for him because it seemed like he was struggling handling the bowls of very hot soups.

xfUHYm5DU-T6w9k-VEcE9g.text: I can't say much about the restaurant or service because we ordered food to go to take it to the pool.  I got the chicken chow mien and my husband got the shrimp dumplings. Both were really good. The chow mien was flavorful and packed with chicken and veggies. I would order to go again!  She also gave us waters in to go cups for the pool!

SjTaAHpAg1H4pi2MEpRBOg.text: Came by for dinner. None of the food was that great just eh. Had chicken lettuce wraps and the house chow mein. I've had better chow mein from Panda Express. They didn't skimp on the meat in the chow mein, but overall bland and just boring. Service didn't redeem anything. Don't go here.

u_xTmlqvyyuS83agPPG_4g.text: Needed to spend a resort credit and no options were appealing.  We decided on this place and I found it to be adequate, but much too expensive for either the portions or the quality.  The pork buns were good, but at $12 for three they were way overpriced.  The vegetable curry I had was not very spicy, was heavy on the eggplant, and was only ok.  The best thing we ordered was sweet and sour chicken, but it was't much better than panda express and sure cost a lot more!  Wish I would have consulted yelp! before checking this place out.  One plus was that the service was friendly.

rge79Kt-Q8APx1eDzRoqMg.text: So the waiter was very nice. The sake was awesome. The sampler platter of cooked dim sum was mediocre and my dinner plate of chicken lo mein was so salty I couldn't finish it. The restaurant was clean but they really need to up their food quality. Definitely not worth the money.

9BbSxZBTtchyBK1HvfkIyw.text: The food was good-Ish but definitely overpriced for the quantity and quality. I came here for the convenience since we stay at the hotel but there are definitely abundant of better choices else where.

rw7o1JlgUHvRkJccH1quwA.text: Pretty good Asian food and I'm an Asian dude. I had the ramen which was tasty and I also tried the calamari, ma po tofu and pad Thai which were all good. The vegetable green curry was meh.

L4YlpWMbgeSOQYuvZ_5iVw.text: Around the Excalibur-Luxor-Mandalay Bay corridor, your Asian food options are quite limited. I have to say that Noodle Shop was actually an ok place even though you are paying 2x to 3x more for Asian cuisine. You are definitely paying for the convenience, but it definitely hits the spot after a long night of partying. I had the roasted duck noodle soup and the preserved egg congee. The roasted duck noodle soup was pretty good, although after a while, you notice the heavy presence of salt. So, after I tasted too much salt, I tried to tame the salt with a bowl of congee. The congee wasn't good at all. I had to douse my congee with pepper to make it taste better which was disappointing.

t3AbqsQCcmAZ_bkhn5qlHQ.text: My wife and I enjoyed a nice meal here before going to see Michael Jackson's ONE.  I ordered the seafood won ton soup and was pleasantly surprised with the amount of seafood.  The soup had shrimp won tons, sea bass, shrimp and scallops.  Soup broth was a bit bland, but I just added chili sauce to kick it up a bit.  My wife had the BBQ Pork Noodle Soup, which contained a lot of BBQ Pork.  She enjoyed her meal and the service was good as well.

uM9kP-MyUj2AFVnBeVTeWQ.text: Service was great. Food was pretty good. I wasn't blown away. Not bad for a casual meal but definitely not for a date.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Main area

5eFT8w1MGyfJ4DjIcnsimw.text: I wish I read the reviews 1st - before dinning here!   It said 2 stars - that's accurate!  How do you mess up Pad Thai!?  Sauce was off / noddles were egg noodles, not rice :/   2 stars for clean / good service 1 star for food

pk7w6X0TWfmk1aoSR7Jn4A.text: Just ok, I started with the pork soup and had yang chow rice. All ok, nothing special at all. It is cheaper than some other spots and has a decent wine selection.   The service is quick and aloof as you might expect. No love when I went so that's a plus. Might go again for take out.

R5Ark2nuIX-V6KUUBdE9ow.text: Do not eat here. This place is overpriced cheap terrible tasting Asian food. Panda Express is much better than this. I've never had worse asain food. The orange chicken was cold, was processed chicken and tasted worse than McDonald's chicken nuggets. Please fire the cooks! How could you have a place like this that gets terrible reviews and not make a change in the food?? My table also had other dishes and nobody liked their food. Even my lemonade tasted like water! How do you mess up lemonade?? $100 later and not happy!

0IyNC9ooPOiDEJYiw0UiBQ.text: Food & service are underwhelmingly blah. Seems like they should be in a run down strip mall instead of an elegant resort.

bhnshl5D5laa-uocNQto0A.text: Food was weird. Not a typical Chinese restaurant, really bright lighting. The pad Thai was bland and tasted like uncooked fish. The hot and sour soup looked like it had already been digested and regurgitated. Would not come back.

IJM6INKakBiJHSenAkLbOg.text: Worst place to eat EVER, are you joking, 18 bucks for fried rice and it taste like microwave food, the worst place ever. Its in mandalay bay and at lease they should hire an asian cook cuz I think they hire a white guy to cook asian food a triple thumbs down! DONT WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY THERE

huc9WPMphAM38pMgTy1PRw.text: Noodle BARF!  I was super hungry and drunk.  Even so I could tell this was the worst place I've ever eaten. How hard it is screw up ramen. It's all in the broth. Staff was even apologetic.  Do your research.  Not hard to fix!

0Vl0zUUpXoVa33RsgHtb7Q.text: Biggest mistake that I made on my recent visit to Vegas was not checking Yelp on this restaurant.  As most reviewers have noted the food is not good and it is way overpriced.  Lowlight of our meal.... My daughter order the BBQ pork noodle soup.  It was horrendous; it smelt and tasted like a bad fish market.  Find any other restaurant.  Don't waste your time or your taste buds.

CrSr6cJt-QVPn1UR7cNE6g.text: Have you ever heard about location location location when it comes down to have business? So this place is one of them.  The food tasted really bad, weird and old. I was so starving, but I could only ate not even half of what I ordered. The server never checked on me if I was doing OK,  even though I was by myself. Not recommended unless you have no choice and starving.

C8dHQjcbNBAJALl1PymEWg.text: So on this trip to Vegas I decided I wanted to eat something else besides burgers, steaks, and buffet food. So I finally gave in and went for some overpriced Chinese food.  I came pretty late (like thirty minutes before closing..which I think was midnight), so I was seated very quickly.      The atmosphere of the place is pretty cozy and chic, but without having that uber "hey look we're a fusion restaurant" look. The menu had a good amount of items that seemed pretty authentic. Anyway I ordered some Chinese broccoli in oyster sauce, beef chow fun, and a roasted duck noodle soup.     Service throughout the night was very quick and friendly (even though the place was pretty much closing) and the servers constantly came by to check on me...which was nice. The food on the other hand...well I don't know what it was...but nothing was that hot...in temperature. As if everything was cooked, but sat out for five or ten minutes before they served it to me.  As for the quality, it was somewhere between what you'd get at a Chinese buffet and actually going to a restaurant in a decent Chinatown. As for prices...well it's Vegas so it's definitely higher than what you'd expect from a Chinatown place (i.e. Beef Chow Fun was like $15...where as in Chinatown would be closer to $8-10). But not going to make you go broke by any means.  I think my only major beef with the place was that my hot tea was luke warm...kind of annoying.    Anyway The Noodle Shop is definitely not a place I would go out of my way for. But the food quality was good enough, the prices were fair, and the service was very good. If I was craving Chinese food and in the Mandalay Bay or near it...I wouldn't hesitate to stop in.   ~G

OT9HIWANWx5NVTaFukBZeA.text: Disappointed that website had number to call for reservations.... I called and NO reservations, but then no waiting..  Website also had kids menu, but got there and NO kids menu BUT server made up for it by honoring kids menu items anyhow.  Food was probably 3.5 out of five.  Staff and service was excellent and warrants the fourth star.  Price comparable to everything else around, higher than it should be.

nt3UC5al-9YYRcWB-2tKPA.text: Wow, this place has gone downhill fast. It used to be my go to late night restaurant. Not any more.  Fried rice tasted stale, and the chicken tasted odd.

bxYRzFCfRL_9RvcqcRTyXA.text: EW.....was walking through Mandalay Bay with my BF on our last day in Vegas and saw this place and got really excited. We were both a little hungover and some chow mein and fried rice sounded perfect.   I SO wish I had checked YELP before dining here. Service was horrible...we were seated right after a couple who looked wasted but were given a great booth and we were given a table in the middle of the dining area...um no  Me: "Can we PLEASE be moved to a booth?"   Hostess: "Oh, hmmm..okaayyy...is this better for you" gave us a nice big booth with some big attitude to boot.   Me: "Yes actually this is PERFECT"  Server was quick, too quick for not being crowded at all. As if she didn't care and just didnt want to talk to us at all. They also forgot my drink, which just irked me in my hungover state.   To the food: the Spring Rolls came out about 10 mins after we ordered them and they were mildly warm. To me this equals: They are premade and left out and then poorly reheated...ew.   I got chicken chow mein...greasy, slimy, gross.  My BF got pork fried rice...I dont like pork and this pork looked totally uncooked and the rice was not "fried" and barely had any veggies.   Our server never came back to ask us if we wanted water and since there was so much sodium in the food we were dying for water. Had to practically yell at her across the room because she was darting about and talking with the other servers.   Bill was about $60 which is fine since we were in Vegas, but NOT for  the quality of the food or the service.

5rkMjGaVs4-zw3MA5kDdig.text: Extrememly fast service which is great when you need a quick lunch while at the pool.  Har gaw dumplings were great as was the seaweed salad. Soup was huge and more than enough for 2, so when they tell you it's small, don't believe them!

qMeKeaD2cECyxaKyEkBajQ.text: The noodle soup with roasted duck was good, the grey goose martini I ordered tasted like a dirty dish towel. My wife sent back the Lettuce wraps saying they tasted like dog food. I didn't know she had eaten dog food before to compare. Who knew ?

OTYnb8W1Fm2cMPOf3LEGdg.text: Pho soup was really good..  Service is okay but far from the best.  I would go with the pho or the wonton soup.

azsdHPwK9Cpo7EcFgi3eNg.text: Food was very good but server openly asked for us to give him a tip....we were giving him a tip by the way... but it wasn't what he wanted. I think his name was Sam so if you get him he'll make you give him a tip he likes not what you want to give him. He wasn't very friendly either as the other staff were. Just beware so he's the reason for 1 star.

9q5-KoU0QzpvnaCn0vn6Ew.text: Had dim sum sampler for 2, seaweed salad, BBQ pork noodle soup. It was just a sponteneous lunch at Mandaley.  Price was not cheap either (we paid about $60).  Will go Chinatown next time.

GQuwAu9DUBcjxIklQ8Mwxg.text: Had the Young Chow Fried Rice which was alright.  The pieces of BBQ Pork could have been larger and tastier.  Service was OK.

tpDU2PEUgaHr_ZZtIrLgcw.text: I feel bad for the folks who had not tried asian cuisine before and this place happened to be their 1st time. Worst Pho we have ever tasted. Incredibly bland, aboslutely no flavor. Bad service. And of course everything was overpriced. Such a huge disappointment for a great location.

jrOIiTiT7wklOzwpVLCfRg.text: Yesterday, I was craving some soup after I saw their advertisement in the Mandalay Bay in house dining section.. I really didn't care for the chicken wraps as much. I think pf changs has better ones in my opinion. I ordered their pho w/ chicken instead of beef. I have to say it was one of the best I've ever tried... I am super picky about my pho. It's so good, that I might go again tonight!

mjCsnrqqpOOIBHBM8EGfmQ.text: We stopped by The Noodle Shop before seeing the Lion King. I had the crazy idea that the larger casinos' restaurants would at least be "decent", so I didn't check Yelp beforehand. I should have known better!  My boyfriend ordered pho and I ordered vegetable pad Thai. We split the seaweed salad as an appetizer. The seaweed was good but the added tofu was unnecessary. Overall though, pretty good. Since there aren't many vegetarian options on the menu, I asked if the pad Thai could be made with vegetables instead of meat. She said that wouldn't be a problem.   Our dishes came and I was disappointed to see that my entree consisted of nothing more than orange, oily noodles and a few pieces of onion. That's it. No extra veggies, peanut crumbles or fresh bean sprouts. I'm sure it would have been acceptable for some hungover frat boy, but I expected a little more. It lacked the taste and texture that's pretty standard at even the worst Thai restaurants. My boyfriend compared his soup to "mall pho" and it was missing the traditional condiments.   Overall, this place definitely wasn't worth the price and I recommend skipping it.

jK6474ivoMH5foiyOSAvUw.text: Of course they're inside of mandalay bay hotel so we expected for high prices for their menus and we are not wrong on that... but service is fine, food taste as well... it is nice for asian food menu

s77dAfbeaeSl_0FJ08h9eg.text: A-ok for a restaurant in our hotel.  We were here a few years ago with our daughter and her friends and it's a quick meal, a bit expensive but convenient if you are staying at the hotel.  Server was friendly since we speak Cantonese (enough to order lol).

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raspberry iced tea

9UPEp2trXeu9jYSJHbVvqg.text: Worst Asian food I've ever eaten. Stopped in because we were in the mood for noodles. Had the chicken Hong Kong noodles and lo mai gai. The restaurant smelled like a bad fart. The noodles were similar to uncooked ramen, and were covered in a thick cornstarch like Chinese goop. We knew it was going to be terrible when we realized you could get pad Thai, pho, and Steamed pork buns all at the same place. The lo mai gai took forever, and surprise-- smelled like a fart when opened. I would eat it normally only if it was the only thing available. I saw a sad lonely man at one table and two old white ladies sitting together, not knowing any better. Perfect for them I suppose. Literally the worst food I've eaten in years. Avoid at all costs, there is great Asian food everywhere but here.

yyx9zODAHA1Nwso0NNgIuQ.text: The service was good and the wait staff was very friendly. The food came out quickly, and the ambience was nice. I was disappointed in the food, everything seemed very bland. We ordered orange chicken, vegetable fried rice, and bbq pork chow mein. I ended up adding chili sauce to the chow mein which helped give it some flavor. The best thing was probably the sauce on the orange chicken. I don't think I would come back, but it's a decent non-food court option in a pinch.

BZHk-apT4KiuAELQ_hS0Dw.text: This place is amazing!!! I have no clue what everyone was talking about my priest blessed the food

vamr68nJuOBNd8S4jeMGUQ.text: I had dinner here with a co-worker. Everything was very good, in my opinion. Our waitress was extremely attentive, very friendly, and was joking around with us. Service was very quick as well. We ordered four different dishes, including the chicken Kung Pao, barbecue combination, chicken wings, and the special chow mein. The only reason I did not give this 5 stars, is because I wish the food would have been hotter, as in temperature. Other than that this was the first time that I've eaten here, and I would come back

Y4_iWmWBGdtSHyfeti-PWg.text: I love ramen. Their ramen is not even close to what ramen should be. Soup is not creamy and not at all tasty. I believe it's not flavored enough and it's like a Chinese noodle soup, with simply clear broth with a little chopped  mushroom, scallions and bamboo shoots! It wasn't really special. The place looks nice but it's seems it's just a facade. I got frustrated there was nothing special with their food. And their servers too! They  seems to lack courtesy and We felt like I'm we were market place while dining. There were lots of shouting and sluggish  movement by their servers. There was even someone using a broom and a pan cleaning around the dining hall while we were there eating! Disgusting! I started to question why would Mandalay Bay have to have such a mediocre Chinese restaurant!

Vkm3ZH7kil37xAAlHS8oxQ.text: Total disappointment.  36.00 for a piece of fish not even cooked asian or any asian style.  Stay away

I5T38TjcgBGjkwVPxYVqSw.text: I cannot for the life of me fathom how such an overpriced restaurant with less than mediocre food and SLOW service has succeeded here in the Mandalay Bay. 2 beers, a flavorless dim sum sampler for 2, and a very fatty, poor quality pork belly bao appetizer results in a $65 bill? VERY small portions. Staff were also unbelievably rude to the hostess, who was about the only one genuinely trying to accommodate guests. Come here again? GTFOH...

n-zJLQHunZ1izwdjzmUVsg.text: Garbage. Garbage. Garbage. Over priced garbage. They should be embarrassed they are making this food. It's not nice to charge so much and give small portions and garbage tasting food. They were rude as well. ITS OFFICIAL... FOOD SUCKS AT MANDALAY BAY. ROOM SERVICE SUCKS TOO.

xsRD00xZuR2czn6GX-WBbA.text: Customer service was great but the food was a let down. It was our first full meal of our day and the last meal of our stay in Vegas and we were excited to try new things and so far were beyond pleased. After we left we yelpled it to see that it was not a 4 star restaurant like the rest but a 2 Star. I would have to agree with that. It's a beautiful restaurant but beyond aesthetics nothing there.

lfa9IAjtgKm78sLx78fODg.text: We thought it was great that we found a Noodle place inside, so we wouldn't have to drive the Strip, but Big mistake! The calamari came out breaded, fluffy, not really crispy, and lacked that flavor. I'm guessing the Ramen needed to be cooked longer, because the noodles were still slightly hard, and not the Ramen flavor. We should've taken the Drive...

sRAuFRmd7W5m16PGnRxwCw.text: I know this place has pretty bad reviews, but I was at a conference and dammit, I wanted Asian food. It's actually a nice little interior, and the service is just fine. I ordered some pork fried rice for $15 and it was a pretty large serving. I was afraid to try $22 pho, but I'll do fried rice. It was also one of the cheapest things on the menu, but the resort restaurants are pretty expensive all around. Even a sandwich at Starbucks will run you like $8.   It's nothing to write home about, but if you don't have time to run elsewhere, it's not so bad.

Djd4v9EFefobMvk0TANtUw.text: Don't do it. Just keep walking... walking away.  The food is terrible. Service is as bad as you'd suspect in a casino restaurant.  Just don't do it.

pRorHESN25ghm1uaKIj_nA.text: The service was good, the food not so much. The noodles tasted like they were frozen then thawed out and microwaved. The potstickers were barely edible and not tasteful. Definitely not worth the exuberant price tag!!!

lfM3zP2tsvE3ZkAGyi3zag.text: So so so so bad! The worst food I've had in Vegas. Such a shame for such a nice hotel. Do not eat here! Absolutely terrible!!!!

bRmEXaBhEPNwOSm64O_esQ.text: Let's start with the Seaweed Salad  It was ok it feels like it was missing something not  SUre what   And I went with the sweet  and sour chicken  Now my friends I have to tell you , that was good it was flavor OVEr CHICKEN " and I say that because most of the time wen I eat SS chicken oh Orange Chicken , is mostly breaded sugar .   Pascual was not my server , but he was on top of everything, water ,how was everything,do I need anything,ect... My actual waitress forgot about me , she only came by to bring my food and the check  ,, we need more customer service like Pascual .

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States. More chicken
Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big peace of goodness
Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flavor over flavor

E36ZTtI933OEZi_dQwGp9w.text: This place was extremely quiet when we arrived. It was around 3pmish....so, in between the lunch and dinner rush. Even with only a few people here, our server took forever to take our order. Which was odd. She would just be walking around. Finally, a different lady came over and asked if we wanted to order....uh, yeah! Dont get me wrong, the servers were friendly. Just slow.   Anyhow, I ordered the sweet and sour chicken and hubby ordered fried rice with shrimp, chicken, and beef. Not much to say. The flavor was bland. Nothing to get excited about. For the Mandalay Bay, kind of surprising this restaurant would just be so so.   Long story short, will go somewhere else next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet and sour chicken. Bland. Blah
Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried rice. Eh, it&#39;s ok.
Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Quiet today

GROit1QtB2NK7VttGeguBw.text: Rude waiters. Guy with the squeaky voice and bowl haircut gave me an attitude when I ordered takeout and then the food wasn't even hot when I got to my room. They also didn't pack soy sauce.   The Singapore noodles ended up causing me to throw up. I think the shrimp was bad.   Don't eat here. It's not a convenience and you'll hate yourself when you wasted money on an overpriced casino restaurant that makes Panda Express look like the French Laundry.

yszc6DrG0WRqHpNrWKa06g.text: Wow.  This is awful.  Why did I not check the Yelp reviews first?  Only after eating here did I decide to look.  This was an embarrassment to Chinese cuisine.  Fatty, lukewarm duck that was inedible; gelatinous hot and sour soup; pot stickers with no filling that were obviously frozen; burnt egg rolls with nasty, strange flavors; and a mediocre ramen soup bowl.  Polite service, and they took some of the dishes off the check, but this place is a disaster.  Avoid.

Hk624W3qB4JW_v3bEGfsDA.text: The food here sucks. Everyone in our party had a stomachache after eating here. The pho was disgusting. Instant wonton noodles are better than the stuff they serve at this restaurant. The Mongolian beef was mostly onions and the meat was still raw. Service was not good. One person had to wait 20 minutes for his food after the rest of us got our food. Do not go to this restaurant.

ZQKmCGJVtZ6lSL5imC17Gw.text: Inside Mandalay Bay, Great environment clean establishement .  I ordered the pork....or was it beef? noodle soup, it was ok , A giant plate of Mexican Clemole would have been better. The coffee was excellent!   I am not an Asian food expert but I have found Thai food to be my favorite and what ever this was wasnt even close as taste is concerned . It was, hmmmmmm....decent.

siiLiUqTYubgvDh7T8s39g.text: service was great but the food quality...oh man! the pho i ordered was so tasteless i always finish my pho but could barely choke it down. the beef pieces were too thick...i suggest slicing them on the slicer thinner and if you cant, freeze the beef so that its easier to slice thinly. the pan fried shrimp and chive was good with the sauce. i wish i got the shrimp wonton noodle soup which my friend got. easier to eat.

czyvbHw73JZGai3IYlYnGQ.text: There is no flavor in the food. The noodle tastes so weird and even worse than instant noodle. It has the worst wonton noodle I've ever tasted.

KJet87cUGihdOsYVoPYNzQ.text: Expensive for Pho. Worst Pho I've had to date...I wanted to eat all of it because Iwas paying so much for it, but I couldn't stand it any more...I ended up leaving my bowl 1/3 full. I ate at Viet Noodle on West Spring Mountain the other day for less than half the price of this Pho and it was some of rhe best Pho I have had in Las Vegas. The lettuce wraps were sub-par. P.F. Chang's lettuce wraps are much better...and less expensive. Service was quick and decent. Though, the restaurant wasn't very busy at 8:30 on a Monday night.

GNRvlBmP3GuOn3Hm1h3d5Q.text: Very good hong kong style food. I don't know why it's only a two star but as a chinese person, the food is authentic. Smaller portion than I expected but all food is overpriced on the strip. Waited super nice too.

4bkwWtdqFdJkH1U6k8x1dw.text: Had a craving for noodles so we ate at The Noodle Shop for dinner.  We ordered:  - 2 meat BBQ Appetizer - Duck and Pork - the pork was a bit tough and the duck was pretty good - Beef Stew Noodle Soup - I liked the beef stew noodle soup - the noodle was al dente; the broth was good; the beef chunks were tender and there was some tendon and Shanghai Bok Choy  as well;   - Shrimp Wonton Noodle Soup - Good wontons and good broth - Beef Chow Fun - smaller than usual portion  - BBQ Pork Noodle Soup  - Choy Sum with Oyster Sauce   Wait staff was attentive.  It was an OK dinner.  Not sure If I'll come back.

FB6sopu4-ftIY7vHyevL6g.text: I grew up around authentic Chinese food and thought this was pretty good.  I suspect the bad reviews come from a higher price for Chinese food.  But i paid $125 for pasta in another restaurant in mandalay and $20 for a beef sandwich next door for lunch at the seabreeze cafe so the prices are in line.  If you want chinese food here i hope the other reviews don't put you off.  I ordered mongolian beef and the bbq mix which included hainan chicken.

fbgW-uV2tmYhryiVKMWT_Q.text: We were pleasantly surprised at the quality of food at Noodle Shop - it was quite good!  We were staying at the Mandalay Bay and we've walked right by it for years, but never bothered to try it.   Well now we have and I can say that I would definitely go back if given the chance.  The Orange peel chicken was soooo good - I am still thinking about it.  The flavor was delicious - and though it was fried, it was not battered so it was not greasy at all.  But the flavor - truly delicious.    Hubby had the noodles with shrimp and xo sauce - which was very expensive for what it was - but still quite tasty.    Service was eager and attentive.  Price overall was expensive for Chinese food.  But if  you're staying at Mandalay Bay - this is a solid choice for a bite.

FSeu2Jvmiz147GqZUyKilw.text: Nice lunch menu for $19.  The Kung Pao Chicken was excellent (and I eat at a lot of non-Americanized Chinese restaurants.

x7c7Fx2HzDSOAoOw0SaG5w.text: We are ordering some wonton noodle soups and an appetizer of dim sum. Soup was just ok, the veggies were a little al dente and raw. The dim sum was ok, just a little sticky. The shu mai was a little dry on the edges and chewy. Lunch was okay but I'd probably look for other options within the resort.

2IffGvSHQJBbAGyQQQ2VnQ.text: Great concept: just had it better and cheaper elsewhere.  With that said, this is a soul satisfying place for soups.  I especially liked the thin noodles with duck and Chinese greens and Bok Choy.  The noodles were a little "dry" in the mouth-feel, but the duck was perfectly cooked.

xwDtL4qGP0I0-P50cEoVxQ.text: I agree with other reviews that service here is really odd. We were seated immediately and then sat waiting for quite a while before the hostess came and took our drink order. I requested a Kirin beer, and then what seemed like a very long time later (and we flagged down staff to ask where our drinks were) I was given a carrot juice. Definitely a possibility of a language issue there... but hey, if you like carrot juice, they have it.  We ordered the Hong Kong Noodles and Singapore Noodles. The first was on the bland side while the latter was bursting with flavor. The Dr. the taught me a few tricks of using the provided sauces, spices to enhance the meal. The food was great and you get a lot for your money. We could have easily shared 1 of the noodle plates.   Still the service needs to improve. As we ate, you could see tables around us also getting slow service and waiting for their bills. I stick with 3 stars based on the quality and quantity of food.

L0GKxdBxdzkix2G0Q-KT4A.text: Panda Express has better quality food than this place!  The kung pao chicken has peanuts sprinkles on top of it instead of being cooked in the dish...it looked like someone sprinkled the peanuts straight out of the jar!  Our second dish, was a sad case of Chow Mein.  I wouldn't recommend eating here unless your super drunk and have lots of money to blow.

4R78K0HLYJjGDs6LgXwx-g.text: Got the duck noodle soup and the wonton noodle soup.  Duck noodle soup is really greasy from the duck.  Shrimp wonton is not bad when my tummy is not feeling well.  Soup base is just right.  The down size is completely over priced.  Each bowl cost $17-$19.  It's nice to seat and eat a hot soup in an AC room.

zeZ9RFpF09yNyfFi_qdn-g.text: Spectacular in all aspects. Great Hot and Sour soup. Great Vegetable Egg Rolls (and mustard sauce and sweet and sour sauce)!  The Scallops and Snow Peas were to die for. I always find scallops to be unpredictable. (At worst, rubbery.). These scallops were tender and delicious. The service was fast and friendly. Table service was white cloth napkin and I thought it was above the "casual dining" it had been described as. We'll be happy to return.

MtBynOidI113YDMKk-U3BQ.text: I know that I live in Irvine, the MECCA of authentic and tasty Chinese food, so perhaps my superior and spoiled palate has a higher standard for Chinese cuisine, but COME ON REALLY!!!! How do you mess up Mongolian Beef?   My boyfriend and I got the Mongolian Beef (more like The Sugah Beef) and Mabo Tofu (it was aiight).   The beef was WAY too sweet! I was expecting a spicy and savory flavor sensation, but clearly the cook was thinking something else!  Definitely won't be going here again! $17.95 for sugary beef makes me a sour puss!

HLzIqc2ok2MLEK212u9arQ.text: Wasn't the best. The food was pricey for the quality. The most annoying thing was that we wouldn't understand a word our server was saying. We constantly had to correct her because she was getting everything wrong. If they want to give their Chinese place an authentic feel, that is fine, but hire people who speak English. It made such an unpleasant lunch to have to do sign language and correct the server because of the language barrier.   The positive: The food came out very quickly.

qO_escGu-NQ7aqSSOj17AQ.text: Most expensive Chinese food ever!! Sad thing is that the food looked and tasted like it was the 1/4 of the price charged... very, very, disappointing!!! We weren't even asked once if we wanted our soda topped off !!

tYA4dkD8_iWsb_44yflzhg.text: Broth bland. Everything we ordered is salty (jook, gong chow lau ho, won ton noodle). Overpriced. Poor quality food. Service was nice. Atmosphere is nice.

mxxOQZ299Bh5jb27y8fh-g.text: This place is honestly not all that bad. The rating for the Noodle Shop is probably low just because A) not everything here is tremendous and B) the prices. I get it. The prices are lofty, but the food is homey and comforting. We decided to get the dim sum sampler, the duck noodle soup, the shrimp dumpling noodle soup, and the sichuan. The sampler? Probably not worth the $20. You get four different types of dim sum, with 2-3 pieces of each type. Tasty, but it might've been better if it were $10 or so. Everything else was very good. The duck in the noodle soup was perfectly cooked, the shrimp dumplings were tasty and plump, and both noodle soups had great broths and noodles. The eggplants were especially delicious. Why a three? Though the food was tasty, I JUST found out that restaurant.com offered a coupon for the Noodle Shop... SO ANGRY RIGHT NOW. Don't make the mistake I made -- retrieve a gift card from restaurant.com before you go here!!!

87E49sYdKAX0gySRAMNLCQ.text: Service wasn't great, and the food was also disappointing.  I wanted some Chinese BBQ pork and the texture was a big grindy and there were still some "wildness" in the taste.  The rice was dry and overcooked.

Eo6_hSqOQSUdI3z4e2DfzQ.text: Not bad if you do your homework and read the Yelp reviews. From what I have read 1. Don't order the Pho.  2. Noodle dishes tend to be salty. 3. The pictures do not have much vegetables in the noodle dishes.  The beef chow fun and the chow meiin have gotten the best reviews on Yelp so far. So I ordered the beef chow fun. Asked for low salt. And also paid an extra $3 for additional vegetables. In the end, I ended up with a decent meal. I may try this with the chow mien next time.

gBO2V9TBXxKam6rKK43ngg.text: Ive always had a great meal here...I was surprised to see a 2 star rating??? Give me a break!Nice atmosphere,fresh tasty food...always the Noodle Wonton soup is my choice...they do a good job.

39hmkrPMgUnpc_H6qYN60w.text: This place was neither bad nor good. It is one of those places that tastes better as your hunger increases. The food is not bad nor is the value. I most certainly have had worse. Obviously this doesn't sound like a glowing thumbs up but in all honesty it is just "ok." The service is marginal at best but if you find yourself with a growl in your stomach and you walk by this place you can rest assured that you will get a decent tasting meal. This place might fair better as a small local hole in the wall Asian restaurant but it is in a major Vegas hotel so the standards shift a little bit. I do not regret having lunch here but I wouldn't tell anyone to drop that hot hand at the tables to come for eats at the Noodle Shop.   The wonton noodle soup was very basic, nothing fancy. It had a decent broth and I felt satisfied eating it, how much will I remember of it after....well that's another story.

1l0Ar133nuNYnjh54HXshA.text: We came here for we were staying at the Four Seasons.   The wonton noodle soup and pho were good but it was way over price.  We probably wouldn't be back.

eYTzS_0SAjHPdDYrURQRAA.text: The food here is just not good. I had the Singapore noodles and they were the worst I've ever had. Stay away.

Ve6fqcaDz3J5h_FDBSHlZg.text: I was pretty famished after landing in Vegas - so I need some lunch immediately. I wish I hadn't made the snap decision of eating here. Considering everything in Mandalay Bay is upscale - I thought this place would be good to eat.  Sorry, it isn't. I had a bowl of seafood soup. Let's talk about that.   Soup Base: Tasted of Instant Replicated Add-hot water broth. Seafood: Yay for reheated frozen shellfish Vegetables: Just a few overcooked leaves of kai-lan?  I paid 15 bucks for reheated shellfish and instant soup?  I won't be around for Round 2.

p79gRt2EVqyq192vA-bPgQ.text: I don't know why this place has such a bad wrap. I have been going here since they opened, which was a long time ago Tonight I had the shrimp dumplings, hay graw and BBQ pork which were all delish I also managed to have a Sapporo with sake. I will admit that the price is ridiculous though... Favorite spot so it won't stop me!

n4fnhfhKTQcvYcSU91_hEw.text: Have roast duck on rice and mandarin braised beef noodle soup. The noodles and the rice part is good but not the meat. My roast duck has distinguishable skin and fat layer, which wasn't that enticing. I would expect a very good bowl of beef noodle soup but the texture of the meat is just too weird. I give an overall 3 start because the service is okay but food doesn't impress me that well.

HDzFGXS5KYxPB3Lua7N85g.text: Dreadful service. Boring food. Stupid prices.  On a relatively slow night, I was seated immediately, but it was fifteen minutes before a waiter came to my table and asked "What do you want?"  "Well, a menu would probably be a good start." I replied.  He disappeared for another five minutes before dropping off a menu without a word.  Ten minutes later, same thing; "What do you want?"  I asked some questions about the food that were answered with only the barest minimum of information.  Service with a snarl seemed the order of the night.  I finally settled on the curried noodles and a cold sake. I should note here, that while I believe that there are several sake options, none other than cold/hot were offered to me, and there was no drink menu.  The dish was like a package of store-bought ramen noodles with just a hint  of curry flavor, but TONS of salt. It also had a few shrimp and some duck bits in it, which was fine for me - but was not mentioned on the menu. Vegetarians beware.   Sadly, with such a salty dish, I never got a refill on my water, nor on my sake - as a matter of fact, the waiter never visited my table again until he brought the check. He never asked if I wanted anything else - desert, maybe - and I had to beg for another glass of water.  He then hovered over me while I figured out the bill (almost $40 for ramen and a glass of cheap sake).  Horrible, horrible, horrible. ...AND, I might add, Horrible.  Don't do it.

1Vx55sHnpPsIg2gYuqRWcw.text: My friend and I ate here for lunch before we were to head out to the Airport. It wasn't something I will rave about forever and a day. But it wasn't bad either.  It hit the spot. I'll take it :) Chicken wasn't over cooked. Sauce was flavorful. It worked quite well in a pinch when we were having a hard time trying to figure out what to do for food before our airport shuttle arrived.

aeknQJnDzdsAObTcvcnVsg.text: I have been here two time and the foods was way over priced for what you got and tasted awful. I don't want to go into much detail because someone flagged my last review of this place, so this is my nice attempt to warn others not to eat here.

rcmggmYNwpg74nnsumEo2g.text: We got in late and needed some food fast. So, we chose to eat in the hotel we were staying at. Noodles sounded perfect.   Aside from the prices that were 2x what we would have expected, the food was mediocre at best.   The Singapore fried rice noodle dish was not much like it was advertised. Wheat noodles, with curry and a few shrimp and slivers of pork. Oh, it was fried. They were just ok. The steamed sea bass was the best of the night. Moist, cooked perfectly. The sauce was ok. Presentation was simple. Finally, the Chinese broccoli was properly prepared and simply served.  100 bucks for that meal. That just didn't add up....  So, ok food for outrageous prices.

-LFU8pGc-z305ESW1F0O5A.text: The worst Chinese food ever. Wasted $25 for a single serving noodle. Will never return.

We13dqspeNBWP-_9Aq5Q1A.text: I still like this lil Hidden hawaiian joint in the CAli hotel.  It's not fancy but the food is hearty and tasteful enough to make you feel like you're eating authentic hawaiian food.  We typically order the Saimwn, daily special, and musubi!

XWtjAyPq38xIP3D52ClGmg.text: I use to count on this place for a good bowl of pho or BBQ pork soup. But times have changed.  Our party of three had both of the above, orange chicken, spring rolls and scallion pancakes and NONE of it was edible. Pho-looked like gray dirty dish water and tasted same.  BBQ Pork Soup- Not sure how they accomplished this but the pork was bone dry even in the soup.  Spring rolls-way too greasy.  Orange Chicken-see Spring rolls.  Scallion Pancake-See Spring Rolls.  Wake up Mandalay and hold your restaurants accountable to have a little pride in what they serve.

EreZaGaJgIfpGRSnmE9mxw.text: Despite peeking at the reviews beforehand, my family and I went to the Noodle Shop since we wanted something light (after having buffet and steak the 24 hrs prior). We were promptly brought to a table. A lady took our drink order, but seemed to be a bit impatient when my dad didn't decide what drink he wanted right away. All of us ended up ordering different things and only my sister was pleased with her dish (seared sea bass), though she was the one who refused to go after I told her about the subpar reviews. My dish had crispy noodles and seafood. It was bland and the texture was sort of uneven (?). My mom's Vietnamese noodle soup was bland and my dad's Pad Thai had no sauce. The Thai tea was good and the service was kind.

MYYEukIZuyRKswaGNRK3yg.text: One of the worst Chinese restaurants I've been to. The waiter recommends chicken chow mein saying it's full of vegetables ,only to find out onions is what he was referring to as vegetable. When asked , he says additional vegetables is going to cost you more!!  . Chicken fried rice is more like white rice with chicken.

9EguQ9U7PeId9IlAQfJfuw.text: Needed soup after a three-hour drive from Utah with a sore throat. Noodles seemed like the perfect place. I got the Duck Noodle Soup and it hit the spot. It wasn't seasoned much, but a scoop of chili sauce helped clear my sinuses.   My friend ordered the sweet and sour chicken, which she wasn't impressed with. The smaller chicken pieces were almost entirely breading and were very hard. She wished she had ordered my lunch.   The staff was polite, took our order, and brought our food out promptly. I did not have any issues with the service.  This place is pretty good, but you should make sure to order its namesake- NOODLES.

vpzuWZl9a-0WgMfUlrfyOQ.text: The Noodle Shop was good.  I know most Asian places in Las Vegas, on the strip in the hotels (not including Panda Express types) tend to be expensive, in the realm of 2x - 3x the price you'd find at Chinatown, with maybe some Asian naysayers touting the possible whitewashing and lack of authenticity of some Chinese restaurants.  Let me tell you 'tho... I've tried most of the overpriced Chinese restaurants in the high end hotels, and I've never had a bad meal.  Sure, there is a bit of sticker shock when you see the menu and get the bill, but the food is indeed delicious and good most of the time.  So, with that I do give 'em the * * * A-OK rating, which I would say I'd come back again and also would refer others to try.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $20 chow mein
Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $24 bbq pork, roast duck, steamed chicken w/ broccoli (gai lan)  platter.
Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1SCCmbjdsK79ySmNzlRqjw.text: I was craving some Asian food and Noodle Shop was the closest thing to me without having to drive all the way down to Spring Mountain also known as Chinatown..... little did I know at the time, the 15 minute drive would have probably been worth it.  Albeit being on the strip, I understand that pricing is going to be a little more "premium", however... the dim sum came out to around $30 and was supposed to feed two people. I could've honestly finished it on my own and still be hungry.  For $30, you can get much value else where especially if you head over to the restaurants on Spring Mountain if you are ever craving Asian cuisine.  To add on to my experience... the soups just aren't worth it either. The service was quick and the server was friendly.... food was just underwhelming especially for the price it was listed at. I would expect more quality being at a nice hotel like Mandalay Bay.

eWRQSIDXrPopxyprAJ9t9A.text: After coming to the Mandalay Bay for a few years and scoping out this place I knew that this trip we had to do it. I love any place that calls itself a noodle shop, especially one with the Asian flair. We found ourselves here for an early dinner and were quickly seated. It only took me a short few minutes before I knew I wanted it all. There was Laksa from Singapore, Ramen from Japan, Fried noodles from different provinces in China,l and the list went on and on. I ended up getting the Pork Ramen and the Duck with rice while my wife went with an assortment of different dumplings. Service was amazing especially the very personable manager that night who went from table to table in even more joy than myself this night. My Ramen was good, flavors were good with ample toppings to go with it, the noodles were very good. My duck was also very tasty and cooked perfectly to go with the rice and vegetables. Dumplings were o.k for the most part. Assorted dumpling platter seemed a bit small for the price but the chive dumplings were absolutely amazing even though they were overpriced. Overall I was happy with my experience, service like I said was amazing, from the manager to the buss boy. Prices were a bit high but I expect that at the Mandalay, and the food was good. I would definitely go back for another try next time I am in Vegas, Aloha

Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cucumber salad

XRhQP3dy9aEgPfhfTFDUXw.text: This is more of a 2.5 star review. The only hit was the hot and sour soup which is one of the better ones I've tasted. However we were disappointed with the ma po tofu and the chow mein.... both were almost cold...definitely not cooked fresh. Even though the service was good, when we ordered the ma po tofu the waitress said "oh that is spicy!" As if these gringos can't handle the heat! This made me excited that this might be an authentic Chinese dish. Much to my surprise it had hardly any spice at all! Wine is overpriced. Dining here made L'atelier Joel Robuchon the night before look like a pretty good deal!

XnOvwAVNYyetQGc_9Ytt6g.text: I tried The Noodle Shop when I was staying at Mandalay Bay for a convention and overall I was impressed! There was a decently long line to get in, so I figured the food would be good. Our waitress was not the best, she waited a long time to take our drink orders and some members of our party got the impression she felt inconvenienced and asked for things. I ordered the shrimp fried rice with scallops and chicken, and it was very good, although a little pricey. During our meal, the manager came by and made sure everyone was satisfied with their food. Overall, I was satisfied with the experience and I would be happy to eat here again.

J21I6VuQt4wmbkS7guLdnw.text: DISGUSTING. Food was cold, probably will make us all sick. I'll be sure to follow up on that. Service was awful. The noodle dish smelled like sewer and I seriously cannot believe they are in business.

hGIIkRI2k-da8eVigEEsZA.text: We were staying at the Four Seasons in Mandalay Bay and decided to grab a bite before our flight. The menu options look appealing, although overpriced but I made the mistake of not checking Yelp beforehand...  Ordered the Spicy chicken curry and white rice. The chicken had absolutely zero flavor to it. The entire dish was bland with barely a hint of any curry. I added mounds of red chili and soy sauce for added flavor just to make the dish palatable.   Service was okay, nothing great. Would not return

h_i_ecez8WxQo6x3quUptQ.text: We came here because it was open late.  1. Hot & sour soup tasted like tomato soup. 2. shrimp and pork wonton noodle soup was delicious. 3, fried rice was ok. 4. Staff was friendly and nice.

KL1VHf2BCRUu0DUtKI2nJA.text: The food was delicious. The service was excellent and the waitresses were so sweet. The prices were a little higher than expected (even for Vegas) but I would come back.

cpwbkFwWgOObU4PkW1XTwA.text: This review in no way reflects Mandalay Bay. But wow,  this restaurant is bad,  very bad. The chicken chow mein had much too much onion and very greasy, worse than the worse Chinese fast food and the chicken was dry.  We also ordered wonton soup. It was okay. Now,  soup should be steaming hot,  this wasn't,  and the wonton wraps were hard.  I asked for a different hotter bowl. The server microwaved it,  instead of heating the broth and new noodles. It came back with a horid smell. How can you serve that? !?!? Drive 3 miles to China town and have some quality decent Asian foods.

-rZahLbIvZcHdxQas_NMbw.text: The reviews are right on this place - its a one star experience. Too bad I didn't read them prior to deciding where to go to dinner in Mandalay Bar. We stayed in The Four Seasons Hotel so our restaurant choices were limited and this restaurant seemed pretty benign so we tried it. What a mistake. Just about everything we had was an indiscernible mess of greasy slop.  Take low quality ingredients combined with out of season vegetables (were they frozen?) and you have the Noodle Shop. The cold and distant service mirrored the disastrous food.

YmULxYI2MzPTY42zbc-o1g.text: The food at this place is sub par, bland and not worth the money. You are better off going to panda express across the st. I was starving and checked in super late, so I had no choice.

oDOV3W-YPmZAHOkSYPjNHg.text: Worst place. You could get any corner of any city better Chinese food than this place.  It used to be a great restaurant. I wonder what happened. It's located inside Mandalay Bay.

wx22umHNIA81YcdI7BbQJQ.text: We arrived late yesterday to our hotel, and looked for a place to sit and wind down. The noodle shop was suggested to eat and relax. First time ever here, food was OK but nothing more (duck/rice/dumpling) . Server was very quick and easy going. Overpriced and quality could be better.

c4RWdTolIqIMA43ecdL6Xw.text: Give me a break. Come on Mandalay! Take a hard look and tell me this place is in any way decent? From the empty seats (should be your first clue), to the criminally bad dishes, it's amazing this place still stands. Rip the whole thing out and drop in something worthy. Please.  This last attempt was my second try. Shame on me.  Order the Pad Thai with chicken and see what it looks, smells and tastes like. Oh, and it's $18.
