OSe6T3CNokCpFRv9TLjwiw.text: Really really not good. Very pricey - everything was watery for some reason - inside of egg rolls were mush, and noodles and dumplings in soup were tough - Many other places that are so much better to eat at Mandalay -

Q6XwxDtUQECoe6TV4lLHLw.text: Was expecting terrible food from reading other reviews.  We had lunch here just before leaving Vegas and were pleasantly surprised.  Everything had good flavor and was well cooked.  We got our food in timely fashion and the waiter was prompt to refill our drinks and ask if we needed anything else.  This is a great place for a quick and yummy lunch!

7o6B6yWyPUiCGwWapAFlvA.text: Terrible. The food was bland and low quality. If you're at Mandalay bay and hungry, keep walking. Plenty of good options close by.

iXc5-ePVAXY6t8HtGIUqmQ.text: This was really bad. Wanted to get a quick bite before a show and they atmosphere, waitresses, and food was terrible. I had shrimp and vegetables which tastes like it was in water instead of a garlic sauce and my husband had a chicken, beef, shrimp dish in brown sauce which was also terrible. Food came out in ten seconds suggestive its not fresh and the bill was brought before I was done eating. No good drink specials.

tF5sefJZLxv1AsKct1m4jA.text: This place was ok! Not nasty but not amazing. i ate the whole pad Thai dish because I was starving but it was pretty bland and everything felt wet. The chicken was wet and soggy.  Don't know if I would go back... It's a mystery to me.

d0nl5S_8USRw4n6sOoB1mw.text: The one star is way too much for this place , the most horrid food I have ever had .. Panda Express is fine dining compared to this. I ordered calamari to start and cashew chicken for my entre , the cashew chicken came first and it was really not edible , I never in my life had to spit food out until I tasted this sh....,  I really think this chicken was really old and had gone bad , it had a funky taste  and not in a good way ,, then my appetizer arrived and it was so bad I. Really couldn't get my self to eat beyond 2 bits.... How is this place in business ??? Why ???

ullrT7LBRm7xvkot89TV8g.text: Even after you read all the reviews and you're thinking to yourself, it can't be that bad... don't go.    If my friends and I could give this zero stars, we would.  We're not sure we've ever had such a bad experience.  Ever.    We ordered pad thai and the shrimp and asparagus - both were lackluster and tasted odd...even the plain white rice tasted smoked or burnt.  We couldn't decide.    Even though it's inside Mandalay Bay, don't be fooled... it's hard to imagine how this place has stayed open as long as it has.    I know this review is harsh, but it's truthful.  Find another place for dinner.  You'll thank me later.

2KO65jZfRZZfLs22le5aRw.text: How can you make something like Pho taste like hot water and still have the nerve to call it Pho?!  When you're in Vegas you need something brothy to bring you back to life and this stuff just made it worse.  I even had to go down to pick it up because they don't deliver AND it's EXPENSIVE!    Tried the bbq pork noodle dish too and that was a huge disappointment!    I've said this before but seriously how are you still in business?!  Amazing!

fHCQkCsYqtVmqHGkgm6-LA.text: Extremely disappointed! I waited over 20 minutes for the worst, overpriced meal I had in a long time.  My takeout order was the roasted duck with rice.  A pretty basic choice -the duck was over cooked and salty.    The meal seasoning must have been all MSG, because my entire body started itching  & developed hives.  If Maladay Resort was smart it shut it down.  Foolish of me for not reading the reviews first.

S43bvCoiVroOrkWaIl1k3Q.text: I have eaten here a few times over the years when conducting business at the hotel/casino. I have never been disappointed with the soups. I usually order the Wonton Shrimp or the Duck.  There are many awesome Asian restaurants in Las Vegas, away from the strip with great food and decent prices.  I don't see this place as a restaurant locals would go out of their way to go to. They are serving hotel guests, gamblers or show attendees. They probably don't really care about their Yelp reviews as much as a local, non-casino restaurant would.  With that said, I would go back if I was already on the property and wanted soup but I would never go to this place as a destination restaurant.

1GOFwPZVmvXRlibBLIuvgA.text: Nice place to grab some Asian food. Came here on a Sunday after visiting the shark reef. Got tired from walking and decided to give this place a try. The food was great. I love the wonton soup the most. Me and my friend both left satisfied.

-7qISVULQbJ3cl4hjEcVrQ.text: The 2nd star is for being open so late. The food is overpriced and not good at all. Meats were fatty and too well done. The shu Mai was not edible.   To further annoy me, not only were all the BBQ meats fatty and too tough to eat, when I was starving, but I was asked when I ordered if I would like rice with it?  I assumed in typical Chinese restaurant style this meant it came with it so I said yes and was then charged $4.25 for it.  Are you kidding me? The shrimp dumplings were the only thing that was good.  I would never ever again come here for this overpriced terrible food.

d_Iomy4ErBG-Z5ijjCS3Bg.text: I don't understand how it survived this far and I regretted for taking a chance despite its low ratings on Yelp.  We ordered 4 dishes which cost almost the same as two dinner buffets but all of them were so disappointing that I left hungry. They were overly salty without the right flavors. Even Panda Express makes better Chinese food in my opinion.

OrdukswDbr41cQ6Ejf_5yQ.text: Wow, this was probably the worst $75 dinner we've ever had. We started with shrimp dumplings which didn't come until after the main course. Which both main courses were disappointing. The orange beef was soggy and gelatinous. The other was mostly onions. Both were those cheap cuts of meat you find at Chinese buffets. Hey but the iced tea was good. But at $5 each it was extreme. The bus boy was very attentive, although the waiter was not. Won't be back.

5ssIGtrNko5Q40LlmVbNbA.text: Had the shrimp wonton noodle soup. Overall it was average and overpriced. You are in Vegas and in a casino so the price was expected. If you're use to Chinatown authentic soup, this would not be the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp wonton noodle soup

KNiTvmGrmv7e7tqEfJmTAQ.text: Ooooohhh emmmmmm geeee. Horrible. Horrible. Panda Express is better than this. And that's a chain restaurant.  We ordered the house special fried rice. Nothing special. Orange chicken. More like battered chicken in oil. Steamed/seared shrimp dumplings. More like fried/burned dumplings. Please do not waste your money here or appetite.

ell2ucLN4QhMqJ4PtmGzcA.text: Sorry, wanted to like it but just can't. We've been here every year for the last 3 years at least. This past month will have been our last visit. The Mongolian beef was expensive, small, and mushy. It was nothing like I'd even expect from our local takeout place. It was more disappointing since we had phenomenal Mongolian beef from Monte Carlo the day before, for cheaper! The only thing that has been decent is their noodle soups but even those are fair at best.  Oh and the worst part was watching them "clean" the dirty tables. After a party left, a woman came to clean off the table. She used one of thief USED a water cups, dumped it on the table and wiped it down with a rag....umm that is NOT cleaning!

-MTb8zaeWWecizpwXggUjQ.text: **Take out Review** I hate to go against the grain, but I really enjoyed The Noodle Shop. My husband and I were in need for some comfort food, and for us, that's noodles. We ordered pad thai and Hong Kong Style Pan Fried Noodles and Seafood to go. The staff was helpful and kind, they kept it short and sweet so that we could be on our way. We had to go take care of some business with the concierge and when we got back, our order was waiting for us.  We took it up to the room and enjoyed our noodles and TV (as God intended). The pad Thai was fantastic, and I am fully aware that it could be because I was starving, but either way, I enjoyed it very much. Mr. R. finished his dish and even had some of mine. I appreciate the Noodle Shop for being different from the other casual fare offered at Mandalay Bay, sometimes you have to take less than desirable noodles in order to get noodles at all.

PPGXKkUFxn1DIEMD3aqe0A.text: Came here cause my parents claimed that this is their favorite place to eat. It's a fairly small restaurant, but it wasn't that busy when we got there. We were seated immediately. We wanted to review the menu a bit before ordering. So they provided us with the water we asked for, but it took them some time till someone returned to take our order.  We decided to order the house special chow mein, BBQ combination platter, and the tonkatsu. I wasn't impressed at all with chow mein. It was bland and the noodles very wet. The BBQ combination platter had pork and duck meats. The flavor was very mild. Then there was the tonkatsu. Ramen is one of my favorite foods and I go to ramen bars regularly. This ramen was like your typical $1 Top Ramen. The broth wasn't the creamy pork broth. But the chasu was pretty good and a fair serving size.   We had then waited for some time till we finally had tinhaik down the staff for our check. Food and service, not worth coming back to again. Sorry...

sECjMEksvbR-bEqFyCe1WA.text: Food:  2 stars Service:  2 stars Ambiance:  2 stars Ended up eating lunch here since there are not a lot of choices.  Food is OK but does not command their pricing.    No flavor.  Beef chunks were OK.  Cup of soup, chow fun and tea will run you over $40.  Not worth the price.  Looking at all available hotels in Vegas, I will probably not stay here either.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chow fun beef.  Just OK but pricey.

ll42lZZbXnVwRiZbIEoRoQ.text: Had a week stay at Luxor for a convention. We had eaten at Most other places down restaurant row and we were looking for something new. My friend pricked it out. The manager was super friendly and quite witty. Drinks came less than a minute after ordering them. Food was great. They have variety you don't normally find at Asian restaurants. They close at 11pm. I wish there were places like this open later in the evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork and Steamed Rice

PY9oeqozo2U4ncjF-sTzyA.text: As with everything in Vegas, it was way too expensive here for what it was. We ordered the dim sum smapler for two. One person could've ate it by themselves. The pieces were very tiny and it was just okay. We also ordered the Hong Kong style pan fried noodles with beef and it was just okay. Nothing that I need to come back here for.  Very underwhelmed with the place.

xUbPQAWJqEwIBF-hklgfXw.text: I was in town for work and we had a lunch break, my coworkers and I only had limited time to grab something to eat before getting back to work. We weren't able to check this place out last year when we came here, so there was no line this time and we were able to get seated pretty quickly.  Place looks nice, tables for small or large groups, nice booths etc. Menu had some good selections and a lot of items to choose from.    I wasn't super hungry so I was thinking I could get an appetizer or two instead of an entree. I noticed they had some appetizers and a small dim sum selection on their menu so I went with that. I got the Chinese BBQ Pork Bao and some steamed shrimp dumplings.    Pretty weak in my opinion. The BBQ Pork Bao I got was pretty average to below average, the BBQ was probably a day old and reheated, a little dry, steamed buns were a bit mushy and sticky so it was tough to stuff it when making your little sandwich. Comes with thinly sliced pickled cucumbers and some hoisin sauce.  Real basic looking, nothing fancy whatsoever at a high price. I didn't finish it.    The steamed dim sum shrimp dumplings (har gao) came last even after my coworker's lunch entrees were served, for some reason they said it takes longer because they have to steam it.  Uhhh....sure, ok. Not much flavor, skin was a bit gummy, the dumpling skin comes off easily, I added quite a bit of soy and hot sauce to it to give it some life.... it was mehhh.    My coworker's ordered some entree dishes like Kung Pao Chicken, I got a few bites because we close like that, good sized meal but at a high price, not the best cuts of chicken, not the most flavorful, it was just ok.    Service was fine, pretty attentive, but the food just wasn't all that at that high price. We've been to most of the restaurants at Mandalay and most of them are real good but this place we will probably pass on. We were in and out of there in about 40 mins, so I had some time to stop by the roulette table before our work meeting, so that was a good thing.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chinese BBQ Pork Bao appetizer........mehhhh

4U4eUTsXl5xQphCjhkTfEg.text: As dim sum goes this place is as good it gets for a upscale albeit pricey feed of our favourites. We had the dim sum samplers and pot stickers , salt and pepper pork medallions.... yummy! Our servers were very attentive and friendly !

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3D8jXMY8CQPDTyvmblghOg.text: Hands down, my favorite Vegas experience.  Good food, fast and friendly service.  We didn't plan on eating here luckily we had a show to attend to and stumbled across this place -- a gift from the universe!

NTM9oRAw88nbqoUoY-06FQ.text: Traveling for work this week at the awesome city of Las Vegas, NV.  I had a little time in between meetings and venture out side of the food courts of Mandalay Convention Center and stumbled onto a cute Asian noodle restaurant called the Noodle Shop.  It was around noon and they had plenty of booths and tables.  The ambience was quite pleasant and reminded me of some of the Asian restaurants in Hong Kong.  We got seated right away but it took 10 minutes for the server to come back and take Drink and food orders.  Finally, the server came back and we ordered the Tonkatsu Ramen and the Beef noodle soup.  I splurged on an extra $3.00 up charge for the request of vegetables.  The soup was ok but not great for $20.00 of broth, pork belly, Raman noodles, and vegetable.  The broth was super greasy and was not as flavourful and I was hoping for.  The vegetables was a great selection.  The pork belly had zero flavours and a lot of fat.  I do not recommend getting the soup based on minimal flavours and a lot grease.  I am sure there were other amazing dishes that they could have executed better on but the noodle soup was not one them based on the name of the restaurant.  It took a good 15 minutes for the server to come back and give us our checks.  Based on the cost and the quality of food I do not recommend this place for a business lunch at the Mandalay Bay selection of restaurants.  Ambience was good and got me excited about the potential taste of the food.  Once the food arrived it did not spark my tastebuds.  The service was very slow despite the lack of customers in the restaurant.    I would like to try this place again in the near future in hopes that the chef would create a more delightful savoury Asian noodle bowl that resonates with the traditional cuisine of Asia.    They should change the name to something that would better meets the expectations of the food because noodle soup by far was not their expertise.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tonkostsu Noodle Pork belly noodle soup

6KAzgVh0hULTN_3aHBkcvQ.text: Bad service, horrible food, gross martinis. Never again. Didn't finish our drinks and complained about the food, server didn't care and told us to dip it in soy sauce. Don't go here.

_f0Yb9-cj0rrpmFHncHn3w.text: This was our last dinner after relaxing for a few days at Mandalay Bay. We came for an early dinner so we beat the dinner rush. Service was good and our server was efficient.   We had the pan-fried noodles with chicken, filet mignon with asparagus and an order of the tonkatsu Ramen. The meat entree came with only one small bowl of steamed rice but that was actually more than enough even with me grabbing a few spoonfuls every now and then.   My hubby's favorite is pan-fried noodles. So when we saw this on the menu we HAD to have it. There was just enough sauce to coat and soften the thin noodles without making it too soggy. The chicken was tender and the veggies were crisp.   The filet mignon and asparagus was light and delicious. The meat was tender and the asparagus was delicious and seasoned well.   The girls shared a bowl of Tonkatsu ramen. I wish the noodles were freshly made but it worked. The broth was good and went well with the mushrooms in it.   In the end, everything was eaten and there wasn't any leftovers. Definitely a good choice for us.

qdswMbC5sCKRHffDfIDKoQ.text: Food is okay but could be better for the price they're asking for.  The server and service was good.  Will I return again?  Probably not.

d6AZ5Vhjv1oqkO4fB4tzfg.text: Just awful. Really really bad. We had dim sum for two. 26$. Thought would be decent amount of food. I am not lying when I say not only was it buffet quality food but tiny portions. The dim sum was ok some BBQ. The rest. Boring plain and no sauce except soy. Just 200% over priced!!!!  Wonton soup. Omg. I LOVE wonton soup. This was terrible. Fishy broth and mystery meat. I asked manager if it was fish broth and he said no. Chicken. Scared to eat it. Not kidding. Smelled like the Gulf of Mexico. Turned my stomach. I love ocean smell of salty air and fish but not in my chicken broth!!! My husband had a signature Chow Mein. Tasteless. Utterly bland. People, this was buffet quality, but worse.   Now as I write this, I'm still in the restaurant. The waiter was kind and sweet, front manager VERY VERY attentive. This was something Kitchen related. Food MUST be revamped into Great Asian food to redeem themselves. I have a very hard time believing that Mandalay Bay is ok with this. FIX IT. I DO NOT return food. I will however tell a manager why I did not eat the food. And we did NOT eat the food (we did eat dim sum but not entrees). He seemed upset we didn't let him make something new. We don't do that. We just do not. It was all not good so what was the point? Was it suddenly going to become great?  I had a myvegas 15$ discount and after complaining manager took 10$ off. Our bill for inedible food was still nearly 60$ (with tip) for two. No alcohol. And no food to speak of consumed. Unacceptable.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I had a casino voucher for 15$.Then manager gave 10$ off.After tip nearly 60$ WORST meal I think I have ever been served

LAKSA ON MENU IS NOT SERVED. Had I bothered to yelp, I wouldn't have stayed.  I ordered vegetarian: *Bok Choy came in flour garlic paste. *Veg thai curry was neither red curry nor green curry - white water diluted coconut milk thrown into a bowl of vegies.

lhssobqdx3BaPcPKCdl6Ag.text: Service was good, but that's about it. We ordered the house chow mein. As a signature dish, we expected it to be good. I'm not even sure I would classify it as decent. Very expensive for subpar food. We ordered two dishes, no drinks, and paid over $60.

NiQN4Aq0sCUZEwbROlWdqw.text: Think Kitchen Nightmares: Gordon Ramsay would shove his plate away in disgust, and exclaim, "This is $%^!!" I cannot stress enough how bad this food was. Like another reviewer, I saw the two stars and thought it can't possibly be that bad if it's in the Mandalay Bay. I was so wrong. It was terrible.  I wanted noodles but did not feel like walking or driving out of the hotel. Although the name would imply that there is a good selection of noodle dishes, this was not the case. It doesn't matter. Don't eat here. I ordered the vegetable spring rolls and the steamed pork and shrimp shumai. The waiter told me it would be about 20 minutes for the dim sum, so I agreed and thought it must be worth the wait. Nope. The shumai arrived in a stainless steel steamer basket, but it tasted like it had been defrosted in the microwave, then steamed for a minute or two for the sake of presentation. It was barely warm. It was a rubbery texture, and the "meat" was just plain awful. The spring rolls arrived looking perfect, and had a nice crunchy wrap. The insides, however, were tasteless mush. I realized that the perfect exterior was likely because they were straight off the frozen food shelves at Walmart.  My husband had the pad thai, and ordered it with chicken. The pad thai was mushy, bland and lifeless. It was a plate of sad noodles, spongy bean sprouts with a side of chopped peanuts.  Again, it appeared to be off the frozen food shelf at Walmart. The chicken cubes added to the dish were rubbery and apparently well past their frozen expiration date. My husband ordered a cocktail, with which he was satisfied, but he asked for a twist of lemon and instead received lemon chunks in his drink. I had the hot green tea, which was acceptable, but not a quality tea.  The female server stopped by and asked (n a heavy accent) how everything was; and as I spoke up to tell her my feelings about the food, she turned her head, all smiles, and walked away. The male waiter did the same thing. They appear to be practiced at this maneuver. Unfortunately, I am too polite to take my complaints any further, so we paid the outrageous bill and left.   The old joke about being hungry a half hour after eating Chinese food? Well, I was hungry before I even left the restaurant. The food was so bad, it was not worth the calories to eat it. I cannot stress enough: DO NOT EAT HERE. Go somewhere else; anywhere else.

Rk7N9uO_Bz0pX1gAkD9E9w.text: Do yourself a favor and avoid this overpriced "Asian" establishment. The only reason I had to go here was because someone in my party really wanted Asian food and this was the closest location.   I ordered the shrimp and pork wonton noodle soup which was not really that good. The broth itself was really bland and the wontons didn't have much flavor either. They were pretty much skimpy with the portions too. I wouldn't even pay more than $10 for this so it stung about my wallet and soul when I had to pay so much for this mediocre dish.   Overall I do not recommend going here. If you want good and cheap Asian food just get it from Chinatown. There aren't that many good Asian restaurants on the strip so stick with other cuisines in the meantime.

DmI5xs8khsimNU5Of-YnVg.text: Should've listened to yelp reviews. This place is overpriced mediocre food restaurant.   Tonkatsu ramen had 3 fatty chunks of meat we couldnt eat, watery broth, little bitty of green onions and nothing else.   Dimsum for 2. DO NOT GET THIS. Comes out with 2 pieces of shumai, 2 pieces of shrimp dumplings, 1 leaf sticky rice, 2 meat humbaos. This is for 1 person, not for 2 people!! Not worth $30. This should be like $10.   Don't recommend this place.

ZWsC-Hsg1vR9GV4gT1Kn-g.text: A little pricey, but worth it.  This is my second favorite place to eat at Mandalay.  It definitely hits the spot when craving a good noodle bowl with quality ingredients.  The proteins are not grisly like a lot of noodle restaurants.  The service always seems to be a little slow, but you really can't go wrong here.  Try it!

7oFSOCzV3SwePD9m30Mt1Q.text: Went there when I was really hungry hoping to satisfy my Chinese food craving. I ordered the bamboo shoots as a appetizer it was edible but not the best. Then I ordered the steak with eggplant and the Singapore noodles as well. Both plates were pretty gross not my flavor palette at all. They did however work with me and not charge me for my meal at all. I wouldn't go back but the only thing good I have to say about it is the staff is friendly and understanding.

31hiWvPXS7Vi7nbAZzy42A.text: Hands down the worst pho I've ever had in my life. I could put together a better dish cooking while drunk (thats pretty bad). I came here other day and the gentleman serving us was very accommodating. Tried the bbq combination platter, not much to say other than it was decent. My lady got the pho; she said it was terrible. I wanted to give the place a benefit of doubt since the food is of her native country. Maybe she was being a little harsh.   Gave it a try today since i had quite an alcohol-filled night, pho if you dont already know is the cure to everything. Wish i could say the service experience was the same as the other day.   Sat down for quite a while until a gent stopped by to see if i wanted anything to drink. This guy wasnt even my waiter, though i would have preferred him to be honestly. He took my drink order and chased down the guy who is supposed to be my waiter. I asked for fiji water because the vegas tap water tastes a little funny. Sure enough he brought out tap water. The gent from earlier saw this and kindly took it away apologizing for my waiter. Fiji arrives with a wet glass inside and out. It looked like the waiter dumped the cup and reused it, not caring to dry off any residue.   In short, stay away from the pho. Service is hit or miss. And i just got the bill without a pen.

4aiWYOJrFt40NibQPWvD8w.text: We should have checked the Yelp reviews before we went to The Noodle Shop at Mandalay Bay.   It is absolutely terrible.  Do yourself a favor and go elsewhere.    We ordered the "Roasted Crispy Duck" appetizer and was told that it actually wasn't crispy, but just roasted.  We got it anyway and it was disgusting.  The taste was lousy and it was some of the worst duck I've ever had.    We also ordered the Cashew Chicken.  Our waitress came out about 5 minutes after we ordered and told us they were out of cashews, but they would make it without cashews.  Are you kidding me?  They ran out of cashews?  Our waitress was awful.  She was extremely annoying and her manager wasn't any better, as she seemed about as clueless as the waitress.    I give you all the same advise I told people looking at the menu when we were leaving: this place is terrible.  Don't eat here.

PA9eU1myY7qCOug2fzbR2g.text: For some reason I didn't read the reviews before I came here. But they're right, 2 stars is even a little generous.  I had the $19 duck appetizer. Now I love crispy duck and could eat it all day, but the skin was soggy and slimy and there were bones everywhere. Then I had the Singapore seafood noodles. I got 2 shrimp, 2 scallops and 1 piece of white fish. Expected more for $26.   With so many other options in Vegas, it's safe to say I won't be coming back.

navHIupLHw6CoeN3QVUz-g.text: I'll give it 2 stars because the good was alright but definitely not worth the price. Seriously? $30 for a standard plate of noodles? And also the waitress had no idea what she was doing when billing our room and took forever for us to get out of there but not before asking if we were going to be taking a box for leftovers (my daughter couldn't finish all of her orange chicken) which we replied yes. She then ended up taking her food, which was roughly half a plate, and threw it away. Not worth the price.

14SzYaFSOvE2ilV1z6VNhQ.text: Yuck, Yuck, Yuck!  The name is Noodle Shop, yet their noodle soup is probably THE worst on the strip or in the entire Vegas.  AND probably the most expensive too!  If you are stuck in Mandalay and you must have a bowl of noodle or you will die - still, don't go there. Just pick up a hamburger and go to bed.  Yes, it is that bad!

atuNZNOy_9G7rsp6gXu_Rw.text: I think this place deserves a higher than 2 stars for several reasons...  1. People are complaining that this place is expensive. Yes, you are in Vegas! It's like a giant airport, just expect to pay at a minimum double what you normally would for everything.  2. This place adds some variety. There's so many places that are just cafes/pizza places.  3. Their noodle soups are good.   The beef brisket soup was good and so was their wonton soup! Just don't venture far from the Chinese noodle soups. (I saw someone getting a pad thai there and it looked pretty bad... Also, their pho was mediocre at best...) All in all, my experience was 4-stars especially because this is exactly what my body needed.

qLJBpqmeKkucDP5_rHA9OQ.text: Inside the Mandalay Bay. If you're looking for a hangover cure.. this isn't it.  Wonton noodle soup- 2/5. I suppose this may be relatively good here? Noodles are hard and soup is generic and MSG tasting.  Thousand year old egg porridge- 2/5. Bland once again with small portion of thousand year old egg and a measly small sprinkle of green onions.  Mongolian Beef- 1/5. More like elementary school 'mystery meat mondays' for $20.  Lettuce mince meat wrap- 3/5. Okay tasting but small portions, more like a small appetizer.   High priced, but then again you are in Vegas so that's to be expected. But the quality is not good. It's much more worth it to drag yourself to a Pho place off the strip to cure that hangover.

v29wB-UJxxRCVpjSGBxggg.text: Terrible service and terrible quality food.   Ordered cashew chicken and received chicken and macadamia nuts.   Everything was bland and overpriced.   Panda Express is leagues better.  Avoid!

RJ0nj5hUZ2OzxINZHklb3Q.text: $28 for Wor Wonton soup? It wasn't that great, even for being hung over.  The manager was really nice, however and comped the bachelorette a mimosa.

hXpgqMbhE44AGwENyUOdmw.text: Oh my do these people deserve their 2.5 stars!  I have been going to this place for as long as I can remember, every time that my tradeshow pops up at Mandalay Bay. And it gets worse, and worse and finally - disaster!  First, I have to say that they have this incredibly amusing waitress who is any other Cantonese style Hong Kong restaurant, would be just as incomprehensible but alas...would only serve you great food, even if it was still moving when it arrived. Living in Hong Kong, I met plenty of ladies like this. And none would have ever remained in a job at such a terrible excuse of a Chinese restaurant. Even by Qwai Lo standards - this was a disaster.  We had a bunch of dishes. The fish was fishy in smell. The noodles - bland. The chicken tastes better in those free samples given out at shopping malls.   It was honestly one of the worst places I have eaten food at - period.  The hotel gave me a 100 dollar gift certificate after we complained about our 45$ meal. They own the Noodle Shop and if they ever bother to read their reviews, it is a real wonder why they don't switch up the chefs/staff and management - fast!

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pF6se9t76kCpOnIlCC2guQ.text: This place had 2 stars at the time I ate here, and honestly, it's not that horrible. This is not the best place, but it is digestible. You want 4 or 5 star quality go elsewhere.   My big complaint however is the price, I get that it's Vegas but 60 bucks for egg rolls, pork buns, a small wonton soup, and pad thai is a joke.

oEtPp85A9R3W_7H_ihabxg.text: I was here the first time last year's memorial weekend and I enjoyed it so much I went 2 days in a row. You can always tell when a place is good when it's busy with patrons and it was, especially full of Asian customers! ;) This time I came in with the intention of ordering the crispy duck noodle soup which was delish! I forgot to request flat rice noodles instead of egg noodles but it was great anyway as the duck was meaty and perfectly cooked. The soup was more than enough especially for lunch. We had a lady named lua (I think) service our table, she was very friendly and attentive, she was quite endearingly cute! A little pricy but the restaurant was clean and didn't look cheap at all, nicely decorated with plants, mirrors, artworks and soft colours used. The toilets are clean and spacious! Free wifi available too. Always a place to visit when I'm in town!!

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmmm.. Crispy duck noodle soup for lunch :)

ua3b_y5LPqIcxcpQJhwlig.text: It turns out Mandalay Bay has pretty much eliminated their room service. So wanting something quick after a long day of working, I ventured in. Of course I read the Yelp reviews after I had been seated and was really nervous that I had made a poor choice.  I decided to go with simple menu items (how can they screw those ones up?) and avoided all the ones that were specifically reviewed as bad.  I went with the chicken satay to start and the Thai curry chicken as an entree. The chicken satay came out and was ok. The peanut sauce it was served with tasted more of taco seasoning (your guess is as good as mine on why) and was not a nice creamy peanut sauce. It wasn't bad, just not what I was expecting.  The Thai curry chicken was a generous portion. The chicken was a strange texture (boiled, maybe?) but tasted ok. The red and green peppers with it were fresh and pretty crispy still. The sauce had some yellow curry in it but not quite enough. The flavor was weak but the spice level was strong. The dish was ok. Not great and not terrible.  All in all, I probably wouldn't eat here again but it's not quite as bad as some of the other Yelp reviews -- at least not with my experience tonight.

XtAISO10aAxNxNFOQg8Hbw.text: Quicky Review: overpriced basic chinese american dishes. Eat elsware.   Ate lunch with the family. Do not get the pho. It is extremely bland and the noodle texture is stiff and not chewy. The pho costs double the price compared to back home, it takes 5 times longer to come out, yet it tastes like warm water with noddles. We also ordered orange chicken, mongolian beef, and garlic lobster. All the items were good but way to overpriced for simple dishes. There are so many delicious restaurants at the Mandalay Bay, steer clear of Noodle House

RxM_Hmf8F4eLEpP9cI0r9w.text: Not horrible tasting but overpriced for something that tastes exactly like generic Chinese Food that I could get for less than half the price!   You should walk over to the Luxor and try Rice instead.

6mE4lvRTcAhW_4XGpHAeFg.text: Being a homesick Hong Konger, my sister and I came here for lunch.  We were starving so I skipped Chinatown which was further away.  They were understaff and could not handle the lunch crowd.  Even though I saw 5 empty tables, the wait line was long and moved very slowly.  I ordered chinese tea (without looking at the menu) first thing we sat down.  Hey, that's how the Cantonese do it!  My sister asked for a pot of hot water.  We ordered the Roast Duck Noodle Soup since it was their signature dish.  We also ordered the HK Pan-Fried noodle with seafood.  The Japanese seaweed salad was also ordered.  I got my pot of tea with one tea cup.  The waitress brought my sister a mug with hot water with this comment - "this is not Hong Kong.  And we don't have enough tea pots to go around".  We looked around and only a few tables had teapots on them.  So they have 4, 5 teapots serving the entire restaurant?  Hmmmm.  During the meal my sister wanted to try my tea so we asked for a tea cup.  Our waiter forget and we had to asked again.  I wish we had also forgotten.  On the check we were charged 2 teas.  We spoke with the manager and he told us the tea is $5 PER PERSON. We DID NOT get 2 pots of tea!  A good manager would have comp the $5.  It's only $5 for them.  It's a rip off.  When the waiter brought the second cup, he should have informed us that cup is actually going to cost us $5.  When they insisted on charging us $5, they lost 2 customers and all others who would read this review.  Can you imagine a family of say 6 ordering tea?  That would be $30 on their bill.  And it's the same amount of tea leaves that goes into that teapot.  Not like they would get 6 teapots.  If your family wants tea, order 1 and bring some cups with you!   On to the food - A good cantonese noodle is al dente.  The noodles we got was super soft / overcooked.  The Roast Duck itself was excellent.  Advise - order the Roast Duck alone, but with rice or another kind of noodle which cannot be overcooked like mei fan or hor fan.  Japanese seaweed salad - didn't taste right.  Something was off with the sauce.    The pan fried noodles was the bomb.  The portion of seafood was generous.    For food I would give 3 stars.  But the high price, the tea charge rip off and the not up to par customer service gets 1 start.

U8itykVQiQnW27mmTGmkpg.text: The worst Asian / Chinese food, I ever had; for several reasons.   First - super over the top pricing.  $7.88 for cup of soup? $26.88 for hard, fatty beef and asparagus??  Second - food was luke warm.    Third - food was bland and tasteless.   Last but not least, the only saving grace was that the server, an older asian lady; was friendly, personable and customer service oriented.

OSIJ673kRXGe7rOjsaElwA.text: Food is OK, but overpriced. Won't focus on the cost since I wasn't paying. Shumai gummy. Supreme stir fry was good.   Now to the bizarre. They ask if they can take the chairs from my table. Sure - no problem.  Then magically 1 by 1 they return. ONLY TO BE TAKEN AGAIN!  If you need the chairs fine but give me some peace while I eat.

RToljq5N3iifahBd13re9A.text: I honestly am shocked to see 2 stars for this noodle shop. We had a perfect experience from start to finish. We arrived at 12:20am (they close at 12:30am), but they took us and we ordered a decent amount of food: shrimp and pork wonton soup (they allowed a substitute of chow fun noodles instead of egg noodles),  salt and pepper chicken wings, pork belly bao sliders, shrimp dumplings, shrimp and pork shumai, and roasted duck. It was all delicious and the offered sauces added additional savor. The broths in each soup were the epitome of comfort food bliss and the dim sum was so good - we would go to the Noodle Shop for lunch, snack, or late night dinner. You can't go wrong. Service was pleasant and quick and no one seemed annoyed that we were last minute customers. I would suggest to give it a try if you're in the mood for tasty noodle soup - it gets cold in the casino!

IpqTEgXOlcaVH4SYjTzG-A.text: Played at the Mandalay Bay and earned a comp to eat here.  Decided it would be better than the buffet as I had already had two different buffets prior to this meal.  Was seated immediately and was able to place our order wothin minutes.  The Noodles Shop is located just off the casino floor before heading to the hotel lobby and elevators.  It is a large place sharing the seating/dining area with the Seaside Cafe formerly The Raffles Cafe.  Don't expect a window seat with a view as there are none available.  What you should expect is a pricey meal with extreme deliciousness.  I ordered the won ton soup with salt and peppered prawns and fried calamari.  All were delicious and prepared to perfection.  The won ton surprisingly had noodles, never seem this before but it was really good.  The salt and peppered prawns were perfectly fried and were so moist.  Same with the calamari.  Let's say I was happy with the meal and service received.  I'll be back again as I'm pretty lucky at the Mandalay Bay.  See you soon!

lje91vFH_fnQg7N7Va1GOQ.text: I was chilling at Mandalay Bay when I walked by the Noodle Shop. Thought I'd give it a try. I got the pork belly boa and the duck soup. i3404yU0SlzhzyzydOTE9g.text: I was invited to have dinner with my BFF and his family. It was my BFF's parent's fave place to eat, so we decided to give it a try. All I wanted was noodles. I was impressed with the ambiance, but then I thought to myself, this must be expensive chinese food to be this nice!   The restaurant is spacious and I was surprised there was a lot of people dining here. We were led to a table, and our drinks were provided. I ordered the house special chow mein to share. When I received it, the noodles looked good, but the taste was lackluster. I had to add soy sauce to provide more flavor to the noodles.   I didn't try the other items we ordered because I was craving noodles. My entree did its job filling me up, but disappointed the noodles lacked in flavor.

Dpx0H0Yfcn4_RcMeoYfclQ.text: DO NOT COME HERE.  Despite the low ratings, I had some faith that it "wouldn't be that bad."  Boy, was I wrong!!!  I can deal with over priced, slow service in Vegas. That is an expectation I am willing to look over, but I cannot stand for the principle behind what happened to us that night and how poorly it was handled.  We were not some drunk people sobering up either, just innocent hungry victims trying to find some comforting soup.    We ordered a beef brisket soup to share.  The price was somewhere in the $16 range.  Fine. Whatever.  But when I was eating my soup, I choked on a plastic wrapper!  It looked like the wrapper from the top of a brand new soy sauce? bottle.  We immediately notified the waiter and I showed him the foreign object found in my food.  He apologized and got us a new soup (what? they CAN bring out food fast?).  He said he couldn't comp it since we only ordered 1 item but we could get 50% off, which made me feel a bit better.    Then at the end of the meal when we got our bill, we only got 15% off.  I questioned this and he said he told us about the 15% discount. This man did have an accent, which I could have misunderstood but I am sure he initially said 50%.  He then insisted that nothing further could be done because we only ordered ONE item.  I couldn't understand this logic.  Why could nothing be done about the current meal and situation at hand?  Frustration to the max.  TL;DR IF YOU CHOKE ON A PIECE OF PLASTIC FOUND IN THE ONE BOWL OF SOUP YOUR ORDERED,  YOU WILL GET $2.50 OFF YOUR BILL AND NOTHING MORE

oNgH8JCyQoMqOI3maU9IwQ.text: First time I've ever had a Thai tea so I can't tell you if its actually good. It was freaking delishous though. At first it seems a bit pricey but once you see it you get a lot. A lot of the time when you get pork in soup its dried out but the pork was moist as can be. The staff was also super friendly. Thank you, Sever Wade (Wai), for the great service :)

I ordered the wide noodles with the seafood and it had no flavor and 3 shrimp and a few scallops and bites of fish. Very disappointing for $28. No flavor. Lots of noodles and not much seafood.  My husband had the street noodles and they were flavorless as well. Don't waste your time and save your money.

The chow mein was not too greasy and had plenty of flavor and my 5 year old daughter and I are picky about our chow mein. The broccoli was perfectly cooked with just the right amount of oyster sauce. rx1iObgQz8QQMUtYp8fmTw.text: Had a quick meal here as it was 2pm and all we had to eat so far that day was Fat Tuesday's frozen daiquiris (yes, with the extra shot). I wasn't about to repeat my L'Atlier experience from last year. I needed something in my stomach before dining at Sage, stat! My friend ordered the beef satay and I got the Hong Kong won ton noodle soup. I've had better, but for under $12 it hit the spot. The broth lacked any of the subtle nuances that you can get with ramen broth, but the won tons had generous amounts of shrimp (and not much else). My friend thought her beef satay was way too sweet. Service was well, True to what I call "Asian restaurant service"--they bring you your food and leave you alone. I rarely tip 15% nowadays but here is where it may be justified. The reason why this place exists is because Vegas attracts a lot of Asian gamblers and if they're like my parents, they would prefer to eat Asian food. Heed my advice and do not eat here if given the choice. A better meal awaits you somewhere else.

akVg9gTwz7qbun96rDsWTg.text: $16.00 for a bowl of pho. you get about 5 or 6 pieces of beef which are very tough, and I think they use a a lot of MSG  in their soup. Service is OK.

6BqKJC5Qm4R07z0860rbew.text: This place is so bad. The servers were snotty when I asked for coffee, he  said " we are a Chinese restaurant, no we don't have coffee" umm funny because every other Chinese restaurant has it. No big deal. Then we waited a good ten minutes just to order. When my boyfriend asked the server if they had crab Rangoon's the waitress snickered and said no. It's not nice to be rude. If the answers are no then fine but snarky comments and snottiness need not be applied when we are spending our money!! Right then I knew we should have left but we were hungry and already went this far. Then the food arrives. My boyfriend ordered the Spivey pad Thai, I  had vegetable stir fry. I added the chicken which was an extra $8!!!! Our food was so bland. I never add spice but this needed something. The flavor was completely missing. This restaurant is the worst Chinese food place I've ever been to in Vegas. You'd think Mandalay would have removed them and not renew the lease by now. It doesn't belong in Mandalay much less any where else in Vegas really. Rude staff, terribly long wait to actually be served, and horrible food. Way over priced for the quality. Do yourself a favor and go to one of many other places inside Mandalay, you'll thank me later. I wished I would have checked yelp before coming here.

80vPKYKq1m-CGaS-R3Gw5g.text: This place is a joke. Save your money and go somewhere else. Panda Express is way better.

aCpgiRp4L5PiONYDLRvA3w.text: Perfect cure for a cold, esp when you're stuck in the Vegas strip.  I'm not too sure why the reviews were so harsh. The service was great, food came out promptly, and the food was good. While the pricing is a bit high, consider that you're in Vegas and in the Mandalay Bay.    Roasted duck noodle soup cured my sinus prob.The flavors were great and the duck was amazing.It really helped bring out the duck flavor in the broth as well. I also ordered the seaweed salad. It was good except I wasnt fond of the mayo salad on the bootm.  Overall, not a bad place. Give it a shot if you're too lazy to head to chinatown for food.

3j7YsUdI1hkqJLp1BHSNtQ.text: I've eaten here a few times now and been pretty pleased. I can think of places worth two stars but this is not one of them. The Singapore noodles are great, with generous amounts of shrimp and chicken. The shrimp were not at all fishy. The shrimp dumplings were plump with shrimp and also very nice. The BBQ pork with mixed vegetables was surprisingly good, very nice assortment of vegetables and a flavorful sauce. Service was fine, though the restaurant was not crowded and the lady with the mop should have waited till we left before mopping all around our table. I would go here again next time.
