B2xrf82hVO4YKIAmW7QbIw.text: We made a big mistake coming here. We were craving Chinese food and this was the only place that we saw open. I ordered a won ton soup and my wife ordered a chicken dish. When we both finished we both came to the same conclusion. The food was the blandest we ever tried. After reading the reviews I realized the mistake we made by walking in here. I highly recommend finding anywhere else to eat.

fFhzply6fI163UEGNAUhFg.text: Oh Boy, nothing sums it up than the service felt very forced and not very courteous from the hostess who sat us, and yes the server herself. You know that ominous feeling like you're just another digit versus maybe a repeat paying customer? Yes that feeling, like asking to get more menus for all of the people in the party? Isn't that restaurant 101 or were they that short on counting fingers to figure it out! The menu: typical choices you would find at all fast food "Chinese" take out. Flavor: tasted like the typical "Chinese" food from any average casino buffet. I say that because we were staying at Mandalay Bay and went to Bayside Buffet and the "Chinese" items were that much better! We had a fairly big party of 14 people, but there was maybe another 3 little parties in the restaurant the whole time we were there. 6 o'clock Saturday on Easter weekend. This place was empty, the service was lacking, you had to ask for everything (refill, napkins, etc). With a handful of workers just standing on the side wall coming from the kitchen, they should've been more attentive to a big party. The only item that was half decent was the Beef/Broccoli only because it was the only entree that came out like it was made to order and was somewhat hot. Everyone's meals were room temperature or looked undercooked. Everything was BLAND! Makes you wonder who cooks and manages this place in a nice Hotel like this. The second star is because the place was clean, other than that all negative reviews are True about this place. I for one would never recommend it no matter the convenience because you'll be paying the average price of $16-19 an entree, where your average good Chinese restaurant you would pay about half across the board. Service :1 Food:2 Price:1   You get the picture, avoid, avoid!

sZRJnZUSveiPXw222XxyEQ.text: First of all I want to say that the food was great! Service was attentive. The Restuarant looks small but it's not it's cozy. Now for the price that everyone complains about, seriously everything on the strip is going to be pricey honestly if it's to expensive then stop complaining and go to McDonalds they raise there prices on the strip. When going to a resort in Las Vegas be prepared to spend money!!! Overall service was great and on top of their game, the food quality is great and the entrees were phenomenal. I see bad stars for this Restuarant but honestly it was most likely from people who can't afford  it  and are looking to complain about something. This place was great and I'm definitely coming back

w_loFYQxGuHPygjEj5fo0Q.text: This is a good spot for a casual/quick lunch. Food was great. Flavor was great. Ambiance and decor was really good. Price was more than what you would expect for a casual spot but not outrageous (~$20 per person). Service is good too. Again, good spot for quick lunch away from the hustle and bustle

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef chow mein lunch special

d4tXHdo3XRNQ2JA9eCAmQg.text: I'm not sure why people are so down on this. I would give it 3.5 to 4 stars.  I was these for a convention so I grabbed a quick lunch   I had the shrimp udon with xo sauce. The noodles were very good tender and the portion was large.  The flavor was good not too salty at all.  Lost of onions and scallions which I liked. It was served piping hot.  I also tried the shrimp shumai. They take longer to make. These were a bit tough and over steamed.  The service was very good and attentive.   I definitely preferred this as a reasonable lunch option in a resort that is not the greasy food court.

kaOInoHv95yVoh6ZpQjSNg.text: I wanted something warm and soupy so I had ordered the pho noodle soup (I figured they couldn't mess that one up even though it was a Chinese restaurant). The soup was lukewarm, noodles were not pho noodles and the thick slabs of beef were impossible to chew through. It was overpriced, bad food that gave me a stomachache right after.

ljWF-smDnFZskBFA5-etFQ.text: I've gone here for years simply because the annual event I attend is at Mandalay Bay and it's the only place that serves food past 9:00pm (which is another problem).  So this year, I'm sitting there with my friends like always, we've had too much to drink like always, and we go to the noodle shop to get some food in us before we go to bed like always.  And finally, after so many years, it dawned on me....this place sucks.  The food is very bland even if you add 15 spoonfuls of hot sauce.  The service is insanely slow even though you can clearly see the servers standing around, talking to eachother, and always exchanging lots of pieces of paper.  The paper exchange thing is lame and annoying and I realized, in my booze induced haze, that this noodle place has been this way every single year.  I'm serious when I say, it is consistently mediocre.  The table is never completely set, you always have to ask for hot sauce or soy sauce.  The whole damn place is using hot sauce and soy sauce but you still have to ask for it.  What's the deal with that?  Last but not least, the prices are absolutely insane.  $19 for a bowl of noodles?  I miss the good old days when every hotel casino had a 24 hour coffee shop where you could get good food for next to nothing.  Screw this place, I don't care how hungry I am, I'm never going here again.

zZx7HWmqFuUFPav5wzh3Fg.text: Mediocre Chinese food with small portions for the price. I'm not a good cook but when I was eating I felt even their special Curry Tofu was something I could make at home and taste the same with sauce from a jar. I was starving and alone so I ducked in a booth and ate everything pretty much anyway. Service was very polite, refilled my water before I realized it was low. Certainly not somewhere I'd recommend but it was okay for what I needed at the moment. (I was debating between here and some of the cheaper, less well reviewed buffets in the area and the price difference with tip probably would only have been $10. If I had a little more time and energy I might have done that.)

LKytMvHay49mXyp8Zm9D8A.text: This is probably a repeat of what most yelpers have said already, but this place is way too pricey for the quality of food.  I had the shrimp wonton soup, which wasn't bad, but wasn't mind-blowing either.  I also ordered the lychee martini which tasted like the juice that comes with canned lychee, and that was it, little to no alcohol content.  My sister had the chicken chow mein which she said was a little too salty.  My mother really liked her rice porridge, however, and I had a bite of the pan-seared dumpling that my other sister ordered which I found rather tasty.  Service was super-friendly though, couldn't fault them for that.  Still, I probably won't be returning.

5H8iYsHx0E2NnKApGeIHmg.text: Astoundingly bad. We had some sort of chicken dish - it had an overly sweet sauce with way too much soy sauce and only after I was half way through did I realize what was really wrong. The chicken pieces appeared to be the preformed chicken  nuggets you get from any fast food joint smothered in a disgusting sauce. You can get better from the freezer cabinet at Safeway. Beef chow mein was tough, greasy and bland.

DQUosrUSyKZzEiFe4FleoA.text: I could give no stars if it were an option. My husband and I stay at Mandalay Bay frequently, and end up eating in some of the newer restaurants since the renovation. My husband LOVES noodles, ramen, udon everything... Ordered the spare ribs appetizer, they were luke warm, ordered the beef stew for myself that I was told my our waitress was THE BEST. It smelled of fish and was FULL of fat.... had the waitress take it back and ordered something a little easier, Pad Tai Chicken and it was RAW! We ended up leaving, and with the manager not being very surprised at our reaction, I can imagine it happens alot...

8NYEbROaWbxKp_GagZeBhg.text: Yeah ummmm. Totally didn't read the reviews before going in here today, and was expecting a bit more flavor from this place.  Got the roast pork (cha chiu), Chinese broccoli  and steamed rice.  Well, I got it like 35 minutes after I ordered it.....  I was kinda pumped to see they had some of my favorites, but I have to say it was pretty bland.  The cha ciu was not sweet enough, and there was little-to-no brown sauce to add flavor. The Chinese broccoli was blanched properly, and had a drizzling of oyster sauce on it----but that only gives flavor to the lucky broccoli that got the sauce.  Again, if you are in need of a real Chinese fix, this joint isn't the top choice.  Head over to the Spring Mountain Rd area...

W6LtkvN8kQ1tcSBd-vXr2g.text: Food was decent price for it being vegas, but the food was really dry. I had the roast pork on rice. It was relatively dry and the rice was badly cook. How do you mess up cooking rice?

mhqg-PXtX_40QNx5znClaw.text: The food is too pricy for the quality. Spare ribs were not the best, soup was very plain  and both entrees were loaded with sodium      and were below par.  The staff is friendly and offered good service.  The atmosphere is nice but what good is a pretty cell phone with bad reception and dropped calls? Would never come here again.

f0HAxfKDBZyEoJVTsNPoUw.text: Not going to complain about the price as EVERYTHING is overpriced in the strip's hotels.  They have decent HK style food and we even ordered in Cantonese.  We had the flat rice noodles with beef and it was excellent.  The "yee-meen" noodles with veggies were alright.

Yltdqcx-daOAyEmFmVrxkA.text: Mediocre Chinese food.  + Located inside our hotel so it was convenient.  - Small portions - Somewhat expensive - Small portions - Small portions - Small portions - And last but not least, SMALL PORTIONS!   The one plate per person rule doesn't apply here.  Two or three plates per person would be more fit.    In Vegas, restaurants should have one of two things:  1) Great food   2) All- you-can This place has neither.  I think the food would've tasted a whole lot better AFTER the Halloween party...

WsJWs3M3whp6bd6zmKE2kg.text: After a few days in Vegas doing what you do in Vegas -- eat, drink, eat, drink, rinse, repeat -- I wanted something "light": Asian food! In more of a hurry and not really caring we ducked in here for a quick lunch. I really wish we would have tracked down a Pei Wei instead...  The pan seared pork (and shrimp) dumplings were very good, but the Pad Thai shrimp fell short. We weren't quite sure what was going on with it, but as my friend noted, "why is it so orange?" might have been one thing. The shrimp were definitely frozen and beyond small, over cooked, etc.  Stick with the dumplings, steer clear of the Pad Thai shrimp.

IfeRuSAwYwCc9kTGuaHGGg.text: I went here in July 2012 and the service was horrible! The hosts and servers barely spoke English. We asked how big the portions were and our waitress couldn't even tell us, she didn't know. She just said, "order your food, if not enough, order more". Once we got our appetizers, they were extremely small. There was not enough for even two of our five party members to eat. We ordered pad thai, which was actually good but they brought us toppings to put on it and there were jalapeno and habanero. We were not told that there would be such spicy peppers. One of our party members is allergic and did not realize they were the spicy kind. She started choking and had to spit it out. We talked to the manager in the end and she made light of the whole situation. All in all, my biggest concern was the major language barrier and the lack of knowledge of the employees.

tau8AqxhDV_7X5tV24SM7g.text: Located in the Madalay Bay, this place is pricey for what it is. Having a restaurant.com gift certificate definitely helped though, so I recommend that. My friend had the pork dumplings. There were only 4 but he said they were very good. The Tom Yum soup was good as well. For entrees we had the mongolian beef and szechuan shrimp. Good, but the place is pretty expensive so it should be good. It's decent and so I may go back.

PsdHaXpNvWwrvfUmmbeQPg.text: Don't waste your time dining here-mediocre food at best with sloppy plating and presentation. Shrimp pad thai was tons of bland noodles, a few tail on shrimp, and some onion with the option to add peanuts and squeeze lime on top. All the limes in the world wouldn't have helped this flavorless dish. Very pricey for quality and value. Be sure you don't expect to try dessert-the check was presented with no question of any dessert or drinks-and when we queried the waitress-we were told they don't have dessert? Drinks, appetizers, entrees, rice, noodles, but no Dessert? Just plain weird.

dJVn8WkrJM5RIxPx1uALzQ.text: Food poisoning from the congee. I wish I had read reviews first. Avoid!

Lxsq_QH5YQYKQRRuz8E2iA.text: Went here last week with my girlfriend.  The waiter was nothing more than a skinny little rude SOB.. Acted like we were a bother and only checked up on us once. Good food, but bad experience.   We asked if they had wonton chips for the soup he freaked out and said "No!!!!!".  I guess we offended him or something lol, he reminded me of the waiter from booty call inside that restaurant where they skimp Bunz on a few shrimps and he complains.

yB7ROoTUHSCbTY_bBxrHWQ.text: Really horrible Asian food in Mandalay Bay, right next to the casino.  I ate there once and didn't go back.

mF02JCzlzyuIlF5bqUW7PQ.text: If I could give this place no stars, I would.  The food is bad and the service is worse.  We told the waiter our pork was raw, he took it, left and never came back.  And they charged us for it.  They also brought the wrong main dish.  I blame myself for eating here

hRPGR6uSi52FAgVP-9Pszg.text: Hello food network, we need intervention - please run an episode of restaurant impossible. Their 16 dollar bowl of pho is awfully bland, you are certainly better off driving 2 miles off the strip to eat a more graceful bowl of pho. I also had their fried rice and it was awful as well. For a restaurant inside a major hotel, I expected plenty more.

F1PJV5I_DXPpSy4_w41j6Q.text: Oh no...one word in a nutshell: BLAND!  Located in the Mandalay Bay casino I don't know how this place stays afloat...you're  better off going to Panda express trust me!

-JwqloGMX65TqIgQkt1GPA.text: My waitress was very sweet - I appreciated that she mentioned that my dish had peanuts in it, even though that is almost the only thing I'm not allergic to.  Stupid allergies. Anyway, the space is lovely, if you have your back to the entrance, you might forget you're in a Vegas casino.   I had the kung pao chicken and it was delicious!!!  $17 delicious?  Probably not.

4LdbjVTEST49gXmPuffp9w.text: some haiku's  Fifteen dollar Pho? Oh hell no, I don't think so We shared other stuff.  Vietnamese drip The coffee helped me revive After long weekend

xVctZpgpPEqYU2B7VMMLbw.text: Honestly horrible. Ordered tofu pad Thai and got chicken, plus it was just tasteless. The rice was overdone. There were more bean sprouts than actual rice. No flavor whatsoever. Never again.

an8Wi4JlJL9SJcXMZQHnzg.text: I was there in January of this year with my sister.  We both had the Shrimp, BBQ Pork, Scallop, Sea Bass, and Won Ton Soup with the added noodles.  It was really good.  I think it was about $25 which is pricey but considering what we got in it-understandable. Service was fine-not like Chinese restaurants in Hawaii where they are almost mean to the customers!  Haha. I'm wondering if the bad reviews are more for the entree type dishes.  My sister and I had no problem with our saimin/noodle dishes or the service.

lEJ4OE4PMRJ6lo4guq8JmQ.text: The price is very high but the quality of the food is deeply unsatisfying.we ordered Yangzhou fried rice and their special fried rice. They tasted the same. Disappointed.

-iD0aUcqM2B8HcWe9dL8cQ.text: Just had the worst crispy duck ever.  It is fat and not done.  Hard to eat.  The one star is for the waitress and the congee.

FyC9mtit6ufuoaRHLwYgTQ.text: If you've ever picked up a piece of gum off the sidewalk, chewed it for awhile, then spit it into someone else's mouth, that's probably the most accurate estimation of this dump's chicken chow mein. The service was unapologetic for how toxic the food tasted. Hot and sour soup was a hidden gem.

0FMDXPNmXjLctvUTiSgjqQ.text: Been here twice, always enjoyed it, generous portions, great staff, the beef noodle soup and bbq pork rice was good, my family raves about the Thai Ice Tea!!! A nice spot for some hot noodle soup.

IpkEB5KJLl8fMdMbbMv8tw.text: One thing I found it interesting is, you paid arms and legs in these kind of hotel restaurant, but the food doesn't taste good at all.   We came here on Christmas day. The service is not very good. 20 min wait with tons of empty table.   Okay. It is a holiday. I am not going to complain. But after we sat down, it took so long for someone to serve us. That is ridiculous.   The food, is well kind of bad. It is eatable. But doesn't taste good at all. If you have a car, it is really better to go out and eat.   Finally, the price... Too expensive !!!! It costs us over $30 per person. If you are not hungry for asian food, you may find a better place to eat in this hotel.

Y5_h64E0Jmr2H8K6SW4ybA.text: This place is a good choice if you like Asian food. I had the chicken pad Thai noodles. There was a lot of noodles, enough to share if you wanted. The staff was friendly and the service was good. Would eat there again on a future trip.

2E5p3Xep5SSqmNkhb4FDiA.text: I grew up eating congee in the most dirtiest of places in Chinatown in Manila.  Those have always been good.    I'm a bit skeptical about the congee here at The Noodle Shop, (just because my surroundings are actually clean looking) but I've got such a serious craving for congee when I woke up and I wasn't having anything else.  Since we were staying at Mandalay Bay, it was convenient to eat lunch here.  I ordered the thousand egg and shredded pork congee ($10.50)  I had to season my soup with soy sauce but the pork itself is already salty. I like the big chunks of egg in there.  Bf had the wonton noodle soup, it was tasteless and for $14 wasn't really worth the money.  Our server was looking distressed from the many tables she was attending.  I thought she forgot about us, but she did manage to throw out a "how's everything??" , just as I was about to look up and respond, she was gone.   Disinterested server and mediocre food.  A skip.

xe3AKYcUNNATJAwjUWRE_Q.text: My favoring chow mein is Chef Chu's near Mountain View, CA. My next favorite? Noodle Shop in Mandalay Bay!!. Good service, noodles were perfectly cooked and pan fried with just the right amount of spices, vegetables and plenty of white meat chicken. Yummy!!

ZNocnebGKWgXkB0BQAKAjA.text: I dont know why everyone rates this place so bad, i thought it was pretty good, good enough to come here twice! Yea of course expect vegas prices, dont complain about the cost. I had beef noodle soup and added won tons for extra $4 that was such a bomb and hearty meal! Had my asian cravings satisfied, they are generous with the meat portions. Also ordered some dumplings that tasted great juicy inside and fresh. 2nd time around I ordered pork, seafood soup no noodles; it came with scallops, shrimp, bbq pork, won tons, squid, and some veggies. Filled me up! I would come here again if i stay in mandalay otherwise its a bit too far from the other hotels.

N5zEoKnnPwBstj01gpTGGw.text: I've been there in October 2014 and it was great. Waiters were nice, place was nice and the Pad Thai chicken I ordered was good

gxu4XzYTbcgugeD78_7M2A.text: This place is crazy over the top pricey for what looks like the 24 coffee shop in most hotels in Vegas.   However, if you just want a dish, it soooo good. I had Singapore Noodles and shall crave them from California.

fsVwdb5q4Ln4jWWEni7Heg.text: All 5 of us agreed that this was the worst asian restaurant we ever ate at. Avoid at all cost!

vky62aUsKSiOslnuv2TSbg.text: I do NOT recommend wasting your precious time in Vegas by eating at this restaurant.  Not only are portions small,  the manager at the particular moment was not customer friendly & tried to give someone else's business card when I asked for hers. If this is her name, Yvonne Chow. SO UNTRUSTWORTHY. I Can honestly say I've never experienced anything like that before.  Unapologetic & rigid. What happened to customer service?  Doesn't exist here! I Wouldn't Expect This at Mandalay,  where we come each time we visit Las Vegas. NO STARS!!!

aA4OkiqBjPtPMTNM-Aiu8g.text: Came here after checking in at the Mandalay late on Friday.  To be honest, this place was okay, but I'll give it 3 stars cuz the service was pretty damn good.   I ordered wonton noodle soup. Not bad, not awesome. Big portion, just pretty average in taste.  BF ordered singapore style curry noodles. They were okay as well, nothing spectacular. I guess if you are hungry and it's late and you dont want to go to the Bellagio for their bomb ass noodle shop, then this is a good option.  We had the duck summer rolls to start. BLECH!! Just gross and hard and not worth it. Also had the shrimp shumai. Eh.. they were ok. Overall, this place was just ok.

njVcmtdvpOswEwT4wXom0A.text: Just ate at the Noodle Shop a few hours ago and everything was great! Being Chinese myself, I know what authentic Chinese food is, and this isn't it. It's comparable to a PF Changs, maybe. I would probably never pay full price to eat here, I had a restaurant.com coupon that I used to get $25 off. We had the sweet and sour chicken and the mongolian beef. Both plates were solid and tasty. Portions are just right and respective sauces were good. At the end of the meal, what was supposed to be a $40 meal after taxes and tip, came out to $15. I felt a little bad since service was great, so I just tipped a bit more. I will probably be back next time I'm in Vegas, but i will be coming armed with a coupon.

lbVpwXbnyglr43TrFY-Mng.text: I was out with the family and I was very disappointed. The service was substandard. I live in Nevada. People ask me for my recommendations all the time. Noodle Shop needs to remind their servers that people come to Vegas to have a great time and want great service. I am retired and I have a lot of time on my hands. I love to eat out. Sorry Noodle Shop. I shall not return.

jiy0X6s4jCS3YC-vui1cQw.text: Noodle House at the Mandalay Bay.   Exactly what you'd expect from a Chinese Noodle House.  Price: Cheap. Food: Will satisfy most. Servings: More than enough for one, unless you always eat supersized meals. Presentation: Nothing fancy, just straight out good food. Taste: We've ordered a few of their dishes and no bad words were spoken, well except that their China tea which cost like a mother... The beef tenderloin noodle i had was delicious.  Wait: It was fast, our food was served in the nick of time after we ordered, like fast food, except the food tasted better than we expected.   Not a fan of noodle houses though. This place ain't that bad if you're craving for hot soup after getting buzzed.

ufVgmdRs6qeZxIt0lvRusw.text: Disappointed!!! Don't come here.   Horrible service!! Rude.   Expensive but food was not worth it!   My friends and I came here to get lunch and the soup we ordered was bland, the wontons were small and lacked flavor. The Thai food was extremely bland, and the the rice dishes....how can you mess up rice?!!   When we asked the waiter to split the check , he made a big deal about it and gave us a scolding look and told us that we should have told him earlier. BUT HOW ARE WE SUPPOSE TO KNOW?!  No one told us ahead of time and all places let you asked for split checks at the end!   Ridiculous. Don't come here. The waiter watched us write down how much tip we were giving him...he lingered behind us. And then picked up the receipt as soon as we put the pen down and stared at the tip amount in front of us and walked away without saying anything to us.   So rude! Never coming back here!!! I think he might have also been the manager. Unbelievable.

7t6EujDAD6n2_4UwGSN8EA.text: Came in to get soup to go. Got ignored for 6 minutes, ended up leaving. Probably just as well since the ratings aren't all that great to begin with.

goZ_9tFM_6OWyvSi1yHSvg.text: We saw the review and were worried. Yet we decided to give a try. Turned out we really liked it! We ordered a fried rice, magnolia filet and a veggie and we were happy about it. It's more like Cantonese style food and the service is pretty good. I'm glad we can have some decent Asian food at Mandalay Bay.

2SlY1V4qCo5h5AyK1xgw3w.text: Came here for a quick lunch with my parents since we didn't want to leave the hotel. We ordered the chicken lettuce wrap and shrimp fried rice. My dad and brother really enjoyed the the fried rice while the chicken lettuce wrap was just whatever for the price we've had better

IjwgZ2BcAfYgzAiytriH8w.text: If you are looking for some delicious pho, this is your place. I have been there once. My fiance and I were craving something healthy and we split a beef pho and a seaweed salad. I must admit the seaweed salad was weird. I had a very strong, almost putrid aftertaste but I highly recommend the pho. It was probably the best pho I've ever had. The broth is amazing and they give you all of the sides. If you are craving something healthy and you don't mind the atmosphere I would definitely recommend this place. The atmosphere is kind of dull and boring but the soup is amazing. Did I mention that? Also, the service was outstanding. We had the sweetest, most helpful gentleman serving us. I stay at Mandalay Bay a lot and I always wanted to try this place. Its pho-king yummy!

gVINrmmYQj4zJmW4knPrvA.text: Hostess was very friendly.  Great food at reasonable price.   We got the broccoli oyster and Kung pao chicken.  Other meals were great and service was fantastic and fast. Request server Wai Q and you will not be disappointed (attentive, friendly, fast)  During the meal the manager, older gentlemen, came over twice to quickly ask how things were and continued on. We respect this at all restaurants.   Would highly recommend eating here.

gkTTXNNzbAjx3TM8dXN6Xw.text: If there was 0 stars, thats what the rating would be for this place. Horrible service, very rude waitress. I still havnt tried the food as I write this but at this point I can care less how the food tastes. Avoid this place!!!!!

nppoodlYq4Oo82T9H_EkhA.text: Great place for vegetarians, no disappointments with any dish ordered over 3 visits ! Highly recommend the green thai curry!!!

eTT8xKuU_pAv9dLHJ008Sg.text: I was nervous I couldn't order anything here that was vegan but there were actually quite a few options. I ordered the mixed vegetable stir fry and it was amazing! Had it over rice and added a little soy sauce. It was super good! Pretty big portion so it's good for 2 people to share.

x6Rlhi0RvHZCynm9cI2Llg.text: Food was good as you expect in Casino.  Price was high but it is in Casino.  Service was bad. It looked only a few servers including a manager tried to cover all, they looked overwhelmed. Everything was delayed. The bill they gave us at last didn't contain a customer copy.  So interesting to see in such business the middle aged manager took care of a bunch of junior cheer leaders to set up their table covers individually.  A short evaluation: they need to hire more people.

U-9VzMJfneLy6KidCqYE4Q.text: Signature House Noodles was disgusting. No flavor! Grosssssss!!!! Staff was nice! Place was neat but food was simply disgusting

GosLpfpJLNfzuxyref3vQQ.text: My boyfriend was hungover and I was craving a soup like dish. He ordered their PHO which was mediocre for how much it costed. But lets be real, it's the strip and Mandalay Bay. It's like trying to get Costco price alcohol on the strip. Not happening. :/ I ordered their PORRIDGE w/ the black egg ("thousand year old egg"). I enjoyed my dish, but agree with my boyfriend. The cost of eating there was a bit more expensive, but we were in dire need of some soup based meals!!! Aside from the cost of the food the service was still really good. ENJOY!

NGC2SA2mecfpKcWYIBgkxA.text: If all my friends get upset stomachs after eating here, expect that you are going to deal with an upset yelper.  Trust me, I don't care so much if I get sick.  But when my friends get sick, THAT is the worst offense.  We couldn't really enjoy the rest of our night because our stomachs felt awful.  However, this is only the beginning of the offenses.  If my friends got sick, I wish at least I could say the food was good. IT WAS NOT! The food was not flavorful and noodles fell flat.  Some of our soups came out lukewarm.  The price of the food here too is completely ridiculous.  I understand that everything is a little overpriced in Vegas but COME ON! You are charging almost $20 dollars for poor quality pho?  You are better off gambling $10 dollars on slots and getting a burger and fries at McDonald's. At least then you would be decently full, maybe make some money, and still have your faculties about you to enjoy the rest of your day.  The one shining star was that the wait staff was super friendly and attentive. Unfortunately, this was not enough to overlook the poor quality and overpriced food here.

YCI9wgRc6M11A9nBXYHd8Q.text: I wanted pho and I didn't want to venture far from the hotel so when I saw this restaurant I thought I'd give it a try.  I was disappointed.  Service could have been friendlier. $17 for pho was a slight shock considering I can get it for under $10 in So Cal, probably at a larger size. The broth was flavorless, even with the added sauces. It just turned into a flavorless spicy broth.  The beef was a little chewy and they don't use Thai basil.   I will say that the restaurant was clean and quiet and service was quick.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho

fP2ySlSmu_JFBtrw5ho9hg.text: Before coming, we read the reviews. We should have listened. However, we were staying in Mandalay Bay and craving warm asian food, so we figured to give it a try- how bad could it be?   We ordered the fried rice, beef chow run, and dim sum platter. To start off, everything is overpriced, but that is fairly typical on the strip. The fried rice was very bland. The beef chow fun was too salty. Nothing seemed to be going right.  Then, it got worse. We were told the dim sum sample platter for 2 would take 15 min to arrive. It took way longer. It consisted of 8 pieces shumai/ dumplings and 2 pork buns. For $30, I was expecting a bit more. To top it all, everything was disgusting. The dumplings were rubbery and everything else look liked it had been dyed with food coloring. After eating 2 pieces, we couldn't take it anymore and stopped.   I've never had such a bad asian dining experience before. I didn't expect authentic food at a hotel in vegas, but I definitely never expected to encounter such a dining experience. Ever.

58LAVhtFDQoMVCobOGPjHw.text: I thought I would try the Sea Bass. ($32).  The server said that it was good and told me to get the one with the sauce.  It was greasy and tasteless.  It was served on a (thin) lettuce bed.  I also ordered a vodka cocktail.  Neither one were very good.  What a waste of time and money.  I should have read these reviews first. NEVER AGAN

A42lWBksxwChUBWzQYfFeg.text: Server Wendy- service 2/10 ( very low China town style ) Food: 2/10 - ( are you sure is Chinese chef at kitchen?? ) Price: 2/10 ( over price ) Portion: 3/10 ( too small ) Coming back ? / you got be kidding

s2W3q_KhjRRVCYDCQvS3VA.text: Love the Mandalay Bay and this is a nice restaurant, but the noodles weren't awesome.  They could have used more flavor.  Great service though.

MturnKvua244U2CF9R7pjg.text: This place was alright. There's not very much special about this place. It was the last minute lets go before it was close at 1130pm meal when the good restaurant was closed on the strip and every one from my party wanted noodles soup. Thai tea was watered down. The only thing good was the pho. Every thing else was bland.   What was on the menu:  Vietnamese beef pho Curry fried noodles  Duck noodles soup

1zxACUmwRqjJVRIZwPycBQ.text: Las Vegas has become an expensive place to eat. When you combine expensive with bad quality you have the Noodle shop. I'm not going to write much. They don't deserve it. Poor quality dished up as a lump of congealed noodles in bad broth.

2Bm7sGulsyaV8oLYkCsbJQ.text: I come here to eat roast duck noodle. I always order double meat and the duck can't be fatty. It's always pretty good. One time I forgot to be fussy on my order like I always am. The duck in the soup was disgusting. If you like non fatty duck, don't forget to be fussy when you order your duck soup.

4jDkjXToN0UNaT79IcT6qA.text: I'm not sure why this place got so many bad reviews. I went in knowing it might be a complete clusterfugg but was pleasantly surprised. Quick service although I really think the waiter we had was acting out the Chinese role. He had on fake black glasses which i could tell has no prescription on them and he sounded and acted like Mr. Chow from the hangover.   Regardless, I had the kung pow chicken dish which came with white rice. It was a large portion and very tasty with a perfect heat level. People complain about the prices but for $19 I thought it was normal.. Were in vegas people.. Everything will be a few dollars more than non vegas prices.  I like that they didn't try to force the sale of expensive alcohol like most restaurants around.   All in all I thought the noodle shop delivered exactly how it should have. Well done!

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6IYEPgz_1QvuqUcqprsS-Q.text: I should have Yelp'd to see the reviews for this so called Chinese food restaurant. If you want to pay for the atmosphere you are more than welcome to do so! The food was overpriced and not worth the money spent. My husband ordered a Mongolian Chicken instead of beef, they were not willing to change the price. I didn't even see any greens in his plate either!  I ordered a Dim Sum platter for two, which to my surprise was a serving for one. I would have gotten more at Ding Tai Fung! Oh by-the-way, they also charge you $5 for hot tea which is complimentary at other Chinese restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mongolian chicken with no veggies. Chicken were chunks vs thinly sliced.
Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So-called Dim Sum platter for two - overpriced!

5ZDI1pmoTpdL2UzAlpK3Lw.text: In simple words, the Panda Express across Las Vegas boulevard is better.  In fact, it makes Panda Express seem like PF Chang's.  The taste of the food is lacking and the cost is outrageous for what you are being served.    I have been there in past years and it seemed good.  However recent experiences indicate to me that something  has changed in the kitchen.  The black bean chicken was bland.  The chicken lettuce wraps (a total of three) were chicken on a unfoldable leaf of romaine.  The sirloin with asparagus sauce was kind of funky.

9f5hOxuazNJSqhY1c3HHpw.text: I had the seafood pho. When I first tasted the soup, it was not good. Pho is all about the broth. I put hot sauce so I can fool my taste buds. After I was done eating, I walked out and headed to the bathroom. My stomach and my body was boycotting. I threw up every ounce. Felt much better but was still left with bad taste in my mouth. Do not get the seafood pho. Nasty.

gakptzCAZTgrVBsXOA6TzA.text: 1/5 stars Located INSIDE Mandalay Bay.  Service was good, but food was not.   Booo..we were hungry, desperate, and thought this place would be a good idea. It definitely was NOT a good idea. Why? 1) Super salty 2) Expensive 3) Peking duck was HORRIBLE  Ordered: 1) Peking duck: 1/5 HIGHLY DO NOT recommend this dish. This was the worst dish on the table. It tasted like peking duck you would pick up at a fast food joint.  2) Spicy garlic beef: 1/5 way, way salty 3) Beef Chow fun: 3/5 this was the only dish on the table that was edible.

tnSt11znX-lGqdVjUCn8oQ.text: It is True what other people said that the prices are high, but that's True of almost any restaurant on the strip.  If you want cheap Chinese food in Vegas, go to Chinatown.  There is actually good stuff there.  But this place actually has very good and authentic Chinese food.  I've been to China about 30 times, so I know Chinese food reasonably well.  This is the real thing, not the gloppy stuff to which most Americans are accustomed.  That may be why some of the reviewers were turned off.  Plus, don't order chow mein!  That is not even Chinese.  Order the noodle soup, the steamed chicken, the steamed fish -- these are the real deal.  I was happy with my meal and would go back.

Y1qf0QHg5G-O1pJVHFWtXA.text: If you're reading this and haven't sat down to eat yet, turn around and leave now. My husband and I have been to Vegas several times, and rarely have a bad meal. This trip we were here three days and this was the only "meh" meal we had (serves me right for not looking up reviews before we sat down.)   We ate here out of convenience - needed a place before the Michael Jackson Cirque show (which is amazing, btw). All the reviews for this place are True. The food is mediocre at best - on par with food court Asian at triple the cost. Service was not good.   All in all, it wasn't the worst dining experience ever, but it's expensive not good food with lackluster service. Skip it.

b_wK7pMEqguaXKy_lkv5zQ.text: What a rip off! I  have never been charged 15 bucks for a pot of Chinese tea . They need to state it on the menu.  Also, our dinner costs 70 bucks for a plate of noodles and a bowl of porridge.  I rather buy a cup of noodles.

OTa_Lcpkq9HQe_ns5bKkDA.text: If I could I would give this place 0 stars. Not good. Ordered chicken fried rice and the shumai. The fried rice was ok. Was a little sweet so wasn't my favorite. The shumai took a while to come out and when it did they did not smell good at all. Honestly they kind of smelled like canned pet food. I chose not to even try them, but my boyfriend took a bite and said they tasted worse than they smelled.

4Y8UFEqUG1qMqOHZHL9cwg.text: This place is absolutely horrible. We ordered the Malaysian Laksa Noodle soup ($21) and Tonkotsu ramen ($17). Completely flavorless. The Laksa supposedly came with assorted seafood. Apparently that consisted of two shrimps, fish cakes, and fish balls. The ramen did not come with an egg and the pork was extremely fat. What a rip off.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork contains too much fat for their ramen.
Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flavorless broth and bad ingredients. Horrible. Horrible. Horrible.

gY8TZ8sI-H00oZvVQJBmmw.text: The service was great even though she was very busy.  We ordered salt-pepper park and Hong Kong pan fried noodles.  I gave it a 4-star rating because our food came warm not hot.   It was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dlvo_fJgC-ID3Jzy0gGxlg.text: Every time I have attempted to visit the Noodle Shop restaurant at the Mandalay Bay something has happened which prevented me from going. (E.g., Closed due to remodeling, closed due to water main break, closed due to stars alignment with Jupiter, etc..)  Anyway, I finally had a chance eat at the Noodle Shop and we weren't disappointed.  My daughter Muff, sister Luch and I were exhausted and broke after spending the day at the Fashion Show Mall.  We barely dragged ourselves back to the hotel and decided to eat before we went to our rooms. (We said that if we could make it to our rooms, we were NOT leaving.  And the previously checked out room service menu didn't strike our fancies.) We perused the menu and here's what we ordered: *  Shumai,  *  Singapore-Style Fried Rice Noodles with Shrimp and Pork *  Shrimp, Beef and Chicken with Garlic Sauce; *  BBQ Pork with Mixed Vegetables  Only four dishes with rice and enough to feed a family of moose!  Everything was delicately flavored and wonderful.  I love garlic, but it can easily overpower any other flavor in its path.  It was present and accounted for in my Shrimp, Beef and Chicken with Garlic Sauce but not overly so.  My sister's Singapore-Style Fried Rice Noodles with Shrimp and Pork was also delicious.  And my daughter Muff's BBQ Pork with Mixed Vegetables was simple yet enchanting.  And the freshly made Shumai was delightful. We had a scrumptious lovely meal to end our day of shopping madness.

3o_eNB6JIutv2913JmrJgA.text: When you're at a hotel, your choices for any type of food are usually limited. At Mandalay Bay, this Chinese restaurant doesn't disappoint...until you see the bill.  The beef chow fun was great and the won ton noodles were exactly what you'd expect from a Chinese place. The menu is fairly large with plenty to choose from. The food is tasty without the MSG overload of most Asian places.   Overall, the quality seems fresh and the service is thankfully prompt and friendly. Everything is on the pricier side so be prepared or head to one of the many Chinese restaurants along Spring Mountain Road.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken beef and shrimp stir fry
Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mongolian beef
Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef chow fun

hnLt0WSqCPkSb5QTCVpn1Q.text: Great service.  Poor food at an exorbitant price!!  I would not return.   I am from a small town and have waited a long time to try Dim Sum.  It was extremely small for the price and very low quality of food.  I will try azgasin somewhere else.

t-KfoqxNEEyGT2NkfLikuA.text: We are staying at the Mandalay Bay and were looking for something open on a Friday at 10:45.  I am on a gym challenge and really just wanted a salad or anything "clean."  I had my own chicken in the room.  Noodle Shop was still seating. The waiter assured me that the stir fry veggies would be mostly steamed.  I asked him for seasoned chicken to be added, but not oil or caloric sauces.  Our food arrived in less than five minutes.  My food was drenched in a brown sauce, but the chicken tasted very blah as if no seasonings were added.  My husband said his Kung Pao Chicken tasted Americanized.  It looked like the same sauce that I had, but thicker.   I also had a medium length black hair in my food.  We didn't complain at the time, unfortunately, but it was a very disappointing meal.

LfGHSn-oed-brNsnWstqpA.text: I'm pretty generous with my reviews...and I gave this place a shot despite the terrible reviews because I was starving and it is so conveniently located to Mandalay Bay hotel rooms.   I ordered the XO shrimp udon to go and it was TERRIBLE. And after tax $31.  So disappointed =T

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My $31 XO udon noodles - flavorless &amp; don&#39;t recommend. Such a rip

BE349-lXyO3RsBmubCmc_Q.text: Panda Express is god compared to this place. Grossssssssssss

bALVzhvlrMzoly17lokpxQ.text: A really sad establishment where servers give zero ****cks and said they only give you forks to eat with and no spoon except tea spoons and giant spoons.

mIliJGXqyioLM68yC8awxA.text: Decent food, high prices and so-so service.  At a trade show, came here two days in a row and got the TOM YUM KUNG SEAFOOD AND RICE NOODLE SOUP.  This offering is described in their on-line menu as "Vietnamese-Style Pho Soup with Beef" - it is not.  It is Tom Yum with ramen noodles and a few carrots, snow peas and a couple shrimp.  It is good but not worth $17.99!

4qObJRzoumRgHT7ITYwYcg.text: Food are definitely edible, but I just wouldn't come back again because for the price and yes, I understand that it is a restaurant that has to pay hefty in rent to be in the Mandalay Bay, the quality just wasn't up to par. My standard wasn't like sky high or anything, I just think I've received better Asian food because Noodle Shop may somewhat be confused of what it is. It's mainly all Chinese food and then you have random dishes from other Asian ethnicity like Pad Thai or Pho so maybe a non Asian person can come in and not see any difference in taste or care much, but for us Asians we are somewhat critically with the food we grew up with.    The atmosphere looks and feels nice, it was in a clean environment so that was a plus, but the end results all comes down to the actual product that it delivers and Noodle Shop did not delivered good food to me.

D2Nsjl1EmFs_G18ejZvypA.text: Appetizer was ok, I got one of the dumplings they had on the menu.  I had a shrimp entree that was decent, I think it was the szechuan shrimp.  But I also tried the Hong Kong Style Pan Fried Noodles and Seafood. It was the worst dish I've ever had at a chinese restaurant. We couldn't eat it. Just don't order that and maybe you'll be ok. Like I said, the szechuan shrimp was ok.

8cSzLDAHTIH4AbWQmNk8eg.text: My wife and I were wandering around Mandalay Bay after visiting the shark exhibit and happened upon a The Noodle Shop. I did not check Yelp until after  we ordered our drinks and appetizer. I'm so happy we stopped there, the BBQ trio was lackluster at best. The chicken was rubbery, the pork was dry and the duck felt and tasted like it had been boiled. Please avoid this please. I expected more out of you Mandalay Bay.

vs5mwMyTFvqmZcP2RqnUIg.text: Everyone in our party said their food was 'good, but different.' The pad Thai was tasty, but orange-colored and more tomatoey than we've experienced. The orange chicken was bland and more crispy than anything. The fried rice rocked! The pho was good, but the beef in it was incorrigible -- tough and had to be cut on a plate, but a nice addition once added.  The service left something to be desired. Nice folks though.

WiuaWQiciJohU166BVpRlg.text: This is a solid 3 star restaurant judging from our one and only experience here.  FOOD. We ordered the BBQ pork over rice and the beef chow fun. The BBQ pork was so-so, mostly because there was a strong spice in there that isn't in most BBQ pork rice dishes I've consumed in my life (I have had many, even in Hong Kong). Still, it was edible and all fine. The beef chow fun was the same experience... Ok / not great, pretty salty but still pretty edible.  SERVICE. Good actually! They checked in fairly often to see how everything was and if we needed anything else. No complaints. If anything, my only complaint was for the table beside us - Chinese mainlanders with a kid who was watching his iPad movie on FULL BLAST. So. Annoyed.   The restaurant itself is well maintained. Felt clean, updated, etc.

DiqgsjKwyNQid3SabvQFlw.text: I learned the valuable lesson of what happens when you don't yelp a restaurant when traveling.. The Noodle Shop was utter crap... Overpriced and seriously mediocre.. I passed by the place and it looked  decent and it was jam packed with smiling Asian folks... I thought that was a good sign.., but boy was I wrong... I tried the seaweed salad with deep fried tofu, seafood wonton soup, and roasted duck/ BBQ pork combo.. The BBQ pork was decent but only had about four bites with the serving.. Totally overpriced $18.... The ice teas were like $4 bucks and of course  you gave to pay for a "small" side of steamed rice... The rice was actually worth it's price tag, but really "how do you f$*k up rice"... If you have a need to waste money and torture you're taste-buds then the Noodle Shop will not disappoint... * gave this place a second star  because the service was good despite it being packed....

ZS7QGjvvEeTiLmEhqx_FZw.text: We ordered the fried rice which was very bland had no flavor and we couldn't  find any chicken in our lettuce  wraps. Service was  a little slow but ok.

ynm9Gu5DbxvjDQLtLs5cxw.text: Huge portions- must have traditional taste for Chinese-  I hated - hubby said was good- he eats anything-

GW2YxuBspSvx5nzmynJ7Yw.text: Sorry to say, worst dinner I've had in a long long time. Service sucks, don't waste your precious time and money

7SX1AJa_Z0KouC_oh8Lz_w.text: We ordered 3 dishes. Crispy Calamari for an appetizer. Then, Orange Chicken & Hong Kong Style Pan Fried Noodles w/ Sea Food.  Crispy Calamari was oily rather than crispy in texture. I did not like the dipping sauce at all, too sweet for me.  It could have been sweet & sour sauce...try adding the hot sauce. Orange Chicken was missing orange flavor. It was strong garlic and soy sauce flavors. Rice was on dry side... Hong Kong Style Pan Fried Noodles w/ Sea Food was tasty. It was over $50 just for food...

mNh44DY21Zx8_wOhRt_BQw.text: Surprised to like the beef and noodles here, but service was a bit lacking and the food was overpriced.  Convenience was the buying driver in this case since I was staying at THEhotel and attending a convention at Mandalay Bay.  This is a lunch spot...no more.

d8Iulhqy06eLVcKhc1Osxw.text: We thought this place was excellent.  The servers are always moving and very attentive.  We ordered the Kung Pao chicken and beef and shrimp in garlic sauce.  Both were delicious.  Prices were usual for an overpriced resort restaurant.

TQro0kUEkBGal5rJY5v3wg.text: Vegas is expensive, but it doesn't justify the price that the 'Noodle shop' is asking!  I can't quite remember, but I think the pho was like $15...  It's just highway robbery!  The place has small portion, and below average taste.    One of the dishes we ordered was the House special fried rice.  The waitress told us it has dry scallop, when the fried rice came we didn't see any.  Toward the end of the plate, then someone found like 3 small strings.  If this place was in Bay area, it would never survived this long  If you must order, the Hong Kong style noodle was decent taste.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Shop - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MXBgWH8e2AQ9VOWwdUNl0w.text: If you like MSG, come to the noodle shop in Mandalay bay to get your $15 a pop wonton soup.    While the service was impeccable and the waiters and waitresses were running around with their cute little Chinese restaurant accents (I am almost certain people do not talk like this normally - the Chinese accent for restaurants is totally romanticized.  i.e. I know plenty of Chinese people with terrible accents and enunciate on all the wrong harsh syllables.)  Anyway, I can't believe we paid almost $30 for 2 bowls of MSG noodles.  It's straight robbery, I tell you.  I'd probably do it again, if I was stuck in Mandalay bay and hungover.

mq8x2xNwTtbZ6D5UxKKmyQ.text: If eating food counted towards your gambling debt than this place should be considered part of your losses. In fact this place is a total loss, a "bad beat".   I had a beef stew over rice, which came out quickly but it wasn't anything special. Brother had a pad thai dish which he said that he's had better.  The place is over priced for average food, but I can't complain about the price, it's Vegas.

5qxLtjqWLkgutW1lOY64dg.text: This place has the worst food ever. We ordered Pho and it was bland. Even putting the sriracha and hoisin sauce was still nasty. Guess how much they charge for a bowl!? 18 bucks! Seriously? Here in Oakland it's 7-8 bucks and it's delicious. Now I understand why it's expensive cuz its a hotel rest. but damn at-least make ur pho better..We also ordered pad Thai and it wasn't good. If you want to get pho go to Chinatown in Vegas it's way better and cheaper. It's not that far. Customer service sucks at this place too. Came here cuz we were in a rush. We didn't want the Pacquiao bus leaving us to go to LA.

rK4BC3Z0VUpnh7qmgGCQlw.text: Wow, where to begin with this place. Only came here because of my brother in-law. He kept saying how great this place was and plus every restaurant there was pack expect this place. I wounded why... So I by pass looking at the tips and reviews that everyone wrote so I can give this place a fair chance.  So soon as we put our name on the list we waited only for about 5 mins. Okay, that is cool place didn't seem so bad. Right? Place look clean, got seat away from everyone else so it was a nice family style of five. Then this is when the stars kept on falling here... We waited for ten mins for the server to get us water and our orders to be put in. We had to flag some manger to get someone to attend to us.   Now comes the good part dinner. We order fried calamari, pancake, and BBQ pork. Out of the three the BBQ pork was the best. The pancake was too powdery too me. And the calamari it was all batter! Horrible. As for our main course the duck soup with noodles was bland. Shrimp fried rice was okay but lucky for me they had sriracha  the house special noodles was okay but again sriracha is needed again.  To sum it all up, come here for BBQ pork. If you really have too. I mean if you have no where else to go and your super hungry. Other than that if you still have the power to wait else where to eat then go somewhere else. This was not worth the money or time to try.

eEKA00srcUvKjHcmmFDajA.text: Disappointing flavorles & soupy pad tha with an off tasting filet of chicken sliced into. I should have complained to the management to get a free meal comp for another Mandalay Bay  I think this was the worst pad that ever, boxed is better!

QPN_UdevWtMHfUD4891-Xg.text: Decent quality noodle soups here, but docked 2 stars on the value proposition.  What goes for $13-$15 here, can be had for maybe $7 in Chinatown.  2x for the Mandalay Bay premium seems a bit high.  This place used to be more of a cheap eats business, but has since changed.

FBmMHBi534GjUGGCbod0uw.text: I wish I could give it 0.00. It was not great, overpriced (26.00 for a very small entree and cup of streamed rice.  Don't go there.

ZFsl788V3-Jpm0y23sOVqg.text: Glad I didn't read the reviews before I ate here.  Actually ordered to go twice during our stay.  Ordered only two items and both times my daughter and I were very happy with the food.  The hostess actually recommended these two items. Yes expensive for Chinese food , but isn't everything in Las Vegas expensive? The pork, chives and shrimp dumplings had a solid amount of meat in it with a light dumpling skin.  Only 4 of them but so delicious.  The chow mein was so great especially at 10:30pm at night.  Both hostesses who took my order were very friendly and my food was ready within 10 min.  We got Togo a second time because I knew my daughter wanted it again.  I'd go here again to our next visit to Mandalay bay.

Ik8SX4vUlxt0Oi2__n6ibw.text: Called for the House Special Fried Rice with chicken and shrimp and the BBQ Pork Fried Rice. Both sucked. I could feel the crunch of MSG on both. BBQ pork had no flavor (zero). House Special Fried Rice was nothing but normal fried rice with chicken and shrimp. Nothing great about the ambience. Go only if you are craving for low grade asian food.

J8d9qpv5efLrect-F7dKLg.text: $18 for a bowl of soup with a 1/2 pound of spagetti noodles, two thin slices of beef, a pinch of basil, a pinch of bean sprouts and a pinch of cilantro with a couple hot peppers.  Maybe it was because it was the end of my four days in Vegas and it gets tiring to be hammered with overpriced food day after day after day, but this was the final straw.

sabWzIhv0CcEzeDK---Ghw.text: Hmmm The Noodle Shop. Me and the girls wanted something cheap and easy, and we didn't feel like going off the strip. So we went to old relible which is The Noodle Shop. We each order the same thing which was Kung Pao Chicken. (I know lame but hey) I ordered my extra spicy and they did not let me down. I swear we each had so much food but as hungry as we were, it was well worth it. Service was a little off but considering we were not in a hurry and had no where to be, it was quite ok.  If you are ever in Vegas and staying at the Mandalay Bay, stop over to The Noodle Shop. Yes the reviews are all over the place but you just may be pleasantly surprised.

Engu0uF97sHcr_ExwYR2FQ.text: Overpriced, underseasoned, disappointing.  We spent $55 and got a cup of hot and sour soup, some seaweed salad, singapore curry noodles, noodles with beef and broccoli (it was $3 to add the broccoli), and a coke.  Friend said the soup was good, the seaweed salad was solid - right amount of sweet and sour, good variation in types of seaweed, yum - only downside was it was sort of warm.  Noodle dishes were not good. Singapore noodles were bland and very, very dry. Like sawdust dry. Tasted like they just mixed together rice noodles, curry powder, and oil. No delicious vegetables, just a few slices of onion, a few measly pieces of BBQ pork, and like 6 baby shrimp. Beef noodles were similarly bland, tasting of nothing but soy sauce. Thank goodness we added the broccoli because that's what was picked out and eaten.  Would not eat here again.

EtKWtiNBF5IsNbWZ7L8sgQ.text: I liked this place! What better way to nurse your hangover than a big bowl of pho or veggie chow mein? Service was quick  and friendly too.  Prices were a little steep, but this is on par for all other pricing at any of the restaurants in/near the Mandalay Bay.  I recommend it if you don't mind spending $20 on noodles.

xBoLRKiZKR4w47Kg6eimhg.text: Anyone that gives this place more than two stars deserves to have their yelp account taken away.   Got the cheaper kung pao chicken (14.50 I think) and immediately regretted it. I would pay 5 dollars for that entree.   Also, the noodles my friend ordered came out in less than 5 minutes.   I don't know about you but 5 minutes is not a lot of time to cook(reheat) anything.   The only reason any1 should ever come to this place is when all the other places inside the hotel are closed.  Make sure to plan your day accordingly :)

gPoQGQTKZCloR0E_u7AYCA.text: The Tai fish soup really needs to have fish in it! Three morons stood talking while I waited for my check. They handle real money like it was an alien from outer space.

PUoz3OaH3dSs2bSSmFcFzg.text: With all the good food around in Mandalay Bay, our expectations for Noodle Shop where high. Unfortunately, for the second time, we were disappointed. We tried it last year, and again this year. Their menu is varied and looks good. But the food we ordered was bland.  This time, we had Pho (Vietnamese Noodle Soup).  We eat lots of Pho in various cities, and this one just wasn't close.   The only saving grace is they offer a shaved ice, with red beans and coconut milk. Yummy!! For this, we went back a couple times for dessert.  But other than this, we do not recommend this place to our friends.

PUVFGs5IFmDXAGhRRbsGJQ.text: UGHHHHHH! after we ate here we were immediately dying from all of the MSG used in the food...everything was WAY too salty. and its very hard to make congee taste bad but they did...  my husband had the pho and a friend of ours had the pad thai.......both of these were absolutely disgusting!!!!!! Its a cute fast place but the food is absolutely disgusting...

KSU2YJdG_IZtWakg_1zcCQ.text: Best Har Gow and Chow Fun!!!  My boyfriend and I went for dinner while we were in Vegas for a week for a convention and loved it so much that we convinced  our group (6ppl) to go for lunch 2 days later!  It is a perfect casual noodle/Asian cuisine restaurant.  Which is great for a casual experience when you tend to eat such heavy, large meals in Vegas.  Amazing Har Gow with a bit of expected wait. The chow fun was delicious... Even when I ordered it without onions or bean sprouts. The pad thai was a tad oily so we asked for light oil the 2 time and enjoyed it. Great hot tea.   The service was a little sub pair ESP for Vegas. The food out-weighed my opinion of this place.

obiGbvdthPGJSfXjbMUkBw.text: Wow really?   I was way too hungover to check yelp before coming here.  That's the last time I make that mistake.  It was way overpriced and flavorless.  Our group had the wonton soup with noodles.  The broth was like boiled water.  I had the lunch special with mongolian beef and hot and sour soup.  Some special at almost 20 bucks.  Not much beef.  Also there were flies in the restaurant.  I could accept that at a hole in the wall joint not a place inside mandalay.   PLEASE DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE!!!

rlLwQdCUB-uzGNnRiftgFg.text: This was a lovely little place!  The service was wonderful - very, very friendly waiter.   Food was really good too. I had sweet and sour chicken which was better than your average American-Chinese stuff.   The pricing was exactly what I would expect from a similar hotel casual dining restaurant in Vegas - definitely no surprise there.  I'd definitely stop by again!

BF7gjwDONW5VSX22lF_8FQ.text: The Noodle Shop was our meal of choice on the even of the 2013 Chinese New  Year.  Located just off the casino floor in the Mandalay Bay resort, it is designed in a simple, and modern style.  The menu is a mix of Chinese, Thai and other dishes. However, if you are looking for True Thai dishes, this is not going to meet your desires. Lots of rice and noodle dishes, which are great to cure a case of the beer (or wine, or bourbon) flu.  Since I was suffering from a strain of the Guinness-Jameson blight, I chose a hot Green Tea and the Roast Duck noodle soup. This was the perfect cure. The duck was excellent, perfectly cooked, perfectly done meat, with a little bit of fatty skin.  The broth complimented the duck perfectly.  It also had some noodles and a little veg, though I wish there were a little more of the greens added.  My wife  had the Tom Yum Thai soup. Good but not really Thai style, missing elements like the lime and the sour style that is common.  When suffering from the 'flu' it is best to have a spicy dish. The hot bean paste condiment is excellent. Nice roasted and smoky flavor. It does pack a wallop.  The price was right and the service was quick and efficient, and friendly. The General Manager stopped by, asked about our meal and when asked, he gave us a little education on the pending Chinese New Year.  A very nice touch.

o75vjkbe6Zyve9ySDA91LA.text: Saw that there were some mixed reviews for the place on Yelp but I was staying at the Mandalay and needed some food.  I was a bit disappointed in the Noodle shop.  The staff was a bit brusque and slow at times.  I felt that the service was extremely slow for an afternoon late lunch with a near empty restaurant while several staff members present.  Figured that the authentic service would be a good sign, but alas I was in for a disappointment.  The food was average chinese food that I could get in Delaware, which if you have read my posts before that is a very low bar.  I ended up getting the chicken lettuce cups as an appetizer and the Hong Kong style noodles with seafood.  The chicken filling was well made with a nice mild sweetness it.  The water chestnuts were chopped and crisp.  As a difference there was some pine nuts mixed in which was a nice crunch and flavor.  Chicken was moderate, but nothing special.  Disappointingly the dish came with only 3 leaves of lettuce for the dish, much too few.  The other problem was that they served it with ROMAINE lettuce, not much of a cup or able to wrap it up.  Poor choice of lettuce type.  Hong Kong style noodles were not freshly made, they were standard type thick noodles.  Not exactly pasty but pretty close.  The fish in the seafood was cold and flat tasting with a bit of gristle.  The shrimp was well seasoned and prepared but that was the only highlight of the dish.  Overall the dish was a bit oily and disappointing.  While I understand that the food would be a bit more expensive because of the location in the casino it was way overpriced considering the quality of the food.  The dishes were of low quality compared to what I would expect at Vegas in a casino.  I avoided this place during the remainder of my trip and would not return.

dK0IveheV_ALBq3P7SciOQ.text: My husband and I really enjoyed this place.  The soups are a must for a good hangover!  I'm giving it 4 Stars because of the Roasted Duck soup, and the service was friendly. 5 Stars are for the "OH MY GOSH!" places. While good, this wasn't one of those.    I think the reason people aren't giving this place better reviews is because they are used to their hometown Chinese joint, which I get, and because it's Vegas and it's pricier than their hometown too! LOL.  We loved it!  It tastes like Sam Wo's in SF, CA! Which I LOVE!  My sister ate here as well with us, and we've literally been craving the place, and my sister is SUPER picky with food!  So, there is my opinion!  I love it.

dZOYw6hHN01v706fDEKQ6A.text: I came here, starving, after unnecessarily fasting for over 15 hours (oh laziness, what you can do to a girl) I came here, STARVING.  I was unpleasantly greeted with a line, however, I was delirious due to hunger so I waited. (I did notice like, 5 empty tables waiting for seats, but the this place was REALLY understaffed)  I sat and ordered Thousand year old egg with shredded pork congee. My mother ordered wonton mein, and my sister ordered... pot stickers?  This place was a mix of different kinds of asian cuisine, I managed to find a red bean beverage and pad thai (not chinese food) So this place could be your fix for all sorts of asian cuisine. The staff understood cantonese, so they're authentic and my entree seemed legit. The congee was super flavorful but it was WAY thick... I'm not saying I like watery congee, but this was like pudding thick. Anyways, the pork was a tad salty, but overall, the congee was really good. My mom seemed content (not stoked) about her wonton mein and my sisters pot stickers looked like fried sui mai.  or not pot stickers of any sort, to be honest.  I liked this place a lot, if the service was better, I'd consider coming back within the same trip.. maybe, the price was very off putting though.

B59cWRBM8diXuQa-Kp6Rnw.text: My husband and I are foodies and enjoy trying new restaurants. This experience started with a martini that was watered down with vegas tap water. He sent it back because he couldn't drink it (he has never met a drink he didn't like, btw). We decided to go with the appetizer menu and ordered the calimari and dim sum sampler. The calimari came out first. It was under seasoned and under cooked. We wanted to send it back, but were afraid after already sending back a drink. The dim sum platter came and it looked decent. It was alright until we got to the shumai. This is my husband's favorite. It tasted like a barn animal's a**hole. My husband actually spit it out. And we refer to him as the human garbage disposal. I have never seen him spit food out. Ever. Additionally, their spicy mustard was watery. My husband asked our waiter if it was watered down. The waiter admitted it was and said it was because they made it with powdered mustard. Our final bill was $79 which included a diet Pepsi and two drinks.

kBUKkc8Cp4CRmpGya5GYuA.text: I've been here a hundred million times. Literally.  They have really good food. I used to come here with the casino hosts from the Mandalay Bay, so we never 'did' lines. But, there are lines, there are tons of people who want to be here all the time, and the place is small.   XO string beans. They have an asparagus thing that is pretty good. Their Pho is so-so. Eggplant is pretty good. Its all good. Its all very very expensive.

odD4koMlp9iTDB35U7lM8g.text: Oddly, for all the negative hype of this place, and the ridiculous price tag (and I'm talking ridiculous - I think we paid the same amount here as we did the Border Grill, and that's a signature restaurant while this one is labeled "casual" by Mandalay Bay), the food was actually pretty tasty.  I think the expense has to do solely with the fact that this is Vegas we're talking about - anywhere people can be bilked to fork over change, whether it be for fois gras or a plate of fried rice, it's going to happen.  That all being said, my potstickers and chow fun were tasty and came out of the kitchen hot.  I was satisfied and pleasantly surprised.  If you're stuck in Mandalay Bay and are craving asian, this is fine by mid-level standards.

oSnie6IqFRCn5y2coqZpCQ.text: It's been more than a week since I was here, but having just found the receipt from this restaurant in my wallet I felt it appropriate to warn all tourists to not eat here.  The Mrs. and I ordered soup and noodle entrees (Won Ton and BBQ Pork) which were tasty, but definitely not worth the $17.95 and $12.25 we paid. A few Thai Iced Teas later we were looking at close to $50 for two people eating soup for lunch. I understand the rules of traveling, especially when you go to Las Vegas. You'll normally spend $10 for every mixed drink and $8 for every beer. That's just how it works and it's fine if you get good food and great service, but that's not what we got.  I'm not sure if it was how we looked or dressed but our server "Wendy" was rushing us the entire time. She kept checking to see if we were done with our soup and kept peaking from behind the exit to see how much longer we'd be eating. Another server came by and tried to take our bowls when we weren't even done. They didn't even leave us an option for desert as Wendy rushed the bill to our table. For mediocre-good food, this place had poor service. I couldn't understand why they wanted us out so quickly, it's not like this place was busy at 2:51pm on a weekday afternoon.   In Summary: The food was good, the tea was fine, the prices were inflated and the service was awful. Instead, go to the Chin-Chin restaurant at New York New York Hotel & Casino for amazing Asian food and top notch service with reasonable prices.
